Title: TOI widens gap, bigger than next 3 rival papers together
Content: The Times of India has a readership larger than the combined readership of the next three general English dailies from outside the Times group, the latest Indian Readership Survey (IRS) has revealed. What is more, TOI continues to grow, its main paper having added 32,000 readers over the last quarter.The IRS for the third quarter of 2019 shows that TOI has an all-India average issue readership of 58.2 lakh, way larger than the 32.4 lakh readers that its closest competitor, Hindustan Times , has. The Hindu with 18.7 lakh readers and The Telegraph with 4.9 lakh are far behind.While TOI’s main paper gained 32,000 readers over the quarter, its closest competitor, HT, lost 24,000. As a result, the gap in readership between the two has widened from 25.2 lakh to 25.8 lakh.The Economic Times, a Times group publication, is in fourth spot among English dailies with 10.8 lakh readers while another group publication, Mumbai Mirror , takes fifth spot with 8 lakh readers. While ET has more than thrice as many readers as its closest rival among financial dailies, Mint, Mirror’s readership is more than double that of Mid-Day, its closest competitor in the segment.IRS data on total readership also presents a similar picture with TOI widening the gap over its nearest competitor, HT, from 83.9 lakh in Q2 2019 to 89.7 lakh in Q3.TOI’s pan-India dominance is also reflected in the many cities in which it is the market leader by some distance. In Mumbai, for instance, TOI’s main paper had an average issue readership of 12.9 lakh, which is about 50% more than HT’s 8.6 lakh. Similarly, in Bangalore, TOI is more than twice as large as Deccan Herald, its nearest rival, with 5.2 lakh readers compared with 2.5 lakh. In Chennai too, TOI’s 2.8 lakh readership pipped The Hindu’s 2.7 lakh. In Pune and Ahmedabad the IRS shows that there is really no competition to TOI.

Title: Celebs’ lunch boxes get a healthy twist
Content: Let’s admit it, our curiosity for what goes on behind the scenes in a celebrity’s life knows no bounds. From their morning rituals to workout regimen, from the names of their pets to what’s inside their wardrobe — every big or small detail about their real life finds many takers. So, to keep up with the popular demand, CT takes a sneak peek into the lunch boxes of a few Tollywood actors who carry food packed from home while being on the go. Read on to find out what’s inside...Earlier I used to have lunch provided by the production team, but now I carry everything from home. All my food is cooked using minimal oil, salt and sugar. I prefer food made in olive oil. Since I don’t eat rice for lunch or dinner, I substitute it with quinoa khichuri. Currently, I am having only veg food, so two bowls of sabji — which includes all kinds of seasonal vegetables except potato — is a must for lunch. I can’t do without some salad on the side. At times, I also end up having a bit of pickle for a twist of taste.— Parno MittraHaving studio food is a strict no-no for me. Everyone knows I am extremely health conscious, so I always carry food from home. My lunch is fixed — boiled chicken tossed in one teaspoon of olive oil, a vegetable sandwich and a couple of boiled eggs. I also like to munch on dry fruits all through the day. Unlike many, I have the whole egg along with the yolk, as it is great for health and works wonders for me. Post lunch, I eat any seasonal fruit. When I’m at home, I have a small bowl of brown rice too, but not while shooting. I try to have balanced meals with equal amounts of carbohydrates, proteins and fats.I avoid eating out as much as possible. So, having studio food is out of question for me. I always carry my lunch dabba from home. I have been off carbohydrates for a few months now. I am only having boiled vegetables, especially papaya, broccoli, carrot and bottle gourd, without salt, along with a bowl of curd, cucumber and a glass of pomegranate juice for lunch. Pomegranate or beet juice is a must for me, as it works as an antioxidant. Alternatively, I also go for grilled chicken marinated in lime juice and onion paste. Besides, I’m a sucker for seasonal fruits too.I prefer having food cooked at home because it’s much healthier. If I start having studio food, I’ll end up becoming double my size in no time! Even food ordered from outside on a regular basis takes a toll on my health. My lunch is fixed – a bowl of masala oats mixed with vegetables and made by ma. Then there is a boiled egg, a bowl of curd, a cucumber and two fruits — one seasonal and the other, always a pomegranate. Trina SahaOne can’t expect healthy food cooked in less oil, low on salt and sugar from the studio. They cook for hundreds of people and it’s not possible to take these things into consideration. So, I carry my meal cooked at home. For lunch, I have a small portion of rice, soup-like boiled dal, chicken or fish cooked with lots of vegetables, one seasonal sabji without potatoes and two fruits. I’ve seen people raising eyebrows at me for having rice, but I think it’s a good source of carbs, especially if had in the afternoon.My friends are not happy with the fact that I am not a foodie. I can have the same food day in, day out, provided it’s healthy and homemade. Whether I am shooting outdoor or inside the studio, my lunch comes from home. The menu is more or less fixed. I have a bowl of boiled vegetables tossed in olive oil. To make it wholesome, some boiled chicken and eggs are added. Having a cucumber and some curd during lunch is mandatory. At times, I opt for just grilled chicken for lunch. I don’t even know how studio food tastes!

Title: Nirbhaya case convict not a juvenile, says SC; nixes plea
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Monday rejected death row prisoner Pawan Gupta’s claim that he was a juvenile at the time of the crime in December 2012 and said it was too late in the day to overcome the concurrent findings of the trial court, the Delhi high court and the SC that he was a major when he and his associates sexually assaulted Nirbhaya, resulting in her death.

A bench of Justices R Banumathi, Ashok Bhushan and A S Bopanna gave a patient hearing to Pawan’s counsel A P Singh but accepted solicitor general Tushar Mehta’s submission that the trial court’s January 10, 2013, order holding Pawan a major was never challenged and it was too late for the convict to claim afresh that he was a juvenile in December 2012, which was contrary to the records.

The bench said, “In the present case, this is not the first time that the petitioner has raised the plea of juvenility. When the matter was pending before the trial court, plea of juvenility was raised by the petitioner at the first instance. The trial court on January 10, 2013, had held that the age verification report of Pawan Kumar Gupta was received and that the accused did not dispute the age verification report filed by the investigating officer and further, he did not dispute the age to be above 18 years at the time of commission of the offence.

“When the criminal appeal (against conviction) was pending before the HC, Pawan and co-accused Vinay had raised the plea that they were juvenile on the date of commission of the offence. Upon consideration of the submissions, the HC had on March 13, 2014, rejected their pleas of juvenility.”

The bench further said, “The same plea was again raised by Pawan in the review petition before the SC. After referring to the submissions of counsel for the NCT of Delhi and the order of metropolitan magistrate dated January 10, 2013, the Supreme Court on July 9, 2018, had rejected pleas of juvenility by Pawan and Vinay and that order has attained finality.

“Considering the earlier orders passed by the magistrate on January 10, 2013, the HC’s March 13, 2014, judgment and the order Supreme Court’s July 9, 2018, order, in our view, the single judge bench of the Delhi HC rightly dismissed (Pawan’s) revision petition. We do not find any ground warranting interference with the impugned order.”

Among the accused, only one was found to be juvenile, who on confirmation of his involvement in the crime was lodged in a reform home for three years and has since been released.

Title: NOU, BRABU to get new VCs soon
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

PATNA: Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar Bihar University (BRABU) in Muzaffarpur and Nalanda Open University (NOU) in Patna will get new vice-chancellors (VC) soon. A panel of names recommended by the search committees for the appointment of the two VCs was submitted to the chancellor on Sunday afternoon.

More than 24 candidates, who had earlier been shortlisted from the applications received in response to an advertisement issued by the chancellor’s secretariat, appeared for the interview before the search committee on Sunday. It is learnt that those, who were called for the interview and interaction with the search committee, included the VCs and pro-VCs of different universities in the state.

The search committee, headed by the chancellor’s former academic adviser and Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar University’s former VC R C Sobti, reportedly prepared a panel of names for the VCs of BRABU and NOU immediately after the interaction with the candidates was over and submitted it to the chancellor. Other members of the search committee were Dr A P J Abdul Kalam Technical University’s VC Vinay Kumar Pathak and Patna University’s retired Hindi professor and JD (U) MLC Ram Bachan Rai.

Yet another search committee, consisting of Sobti, Pathak and Patna University VC Rash Bihari Prasad Singh interacted with the candidates shortlisted for the post of Magadh University pro-VC. This committee also submitted a panel of recommended names to the chancellor.

It is expected that governor-cum-chancellor Phagu Chauhan will make these appointments after consulting chief minister Nitish Kumar.

Title: Commuters say bus corridors didn’t serve purpose
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Jaipur: The feasibility of the multi-crore Bus Rapid Transport System ( BRTS ) project has come under the scanner after years of its construction with majority of commuters and residents claiming these dedicated lines were not feasible.

While experts have cited studies arguing that priority bus lane was a necessity for streamlined traffic, daily commuters have ruled it out.

Vikas Sharma, who owns a showroom on Ajmer Road said, “The incomplete implementation of project is reason for fatal accidents. Commuters are often confused which streetlight should be followed at junction. Buses have also hit vehicles.”

Commuters also alleged that the corridor was defunct as majority of the times buses ply outside the designated zone to pick up maximum passengers. Moreover, at entry and exit points of these corridors, traffic is blocked by these buses.

Jatin Mehta, a resident of Vaishali Nagar said, “Many people must have noticed that even the low-floor buses do not run inside the corridor to compete with mini buses to pick up passengers. As there is no enforcement, these buses run outside the zones. Sometimes, possibilities of accident arises as many drivers overtake other vehicles while recklessly trying to enter inside the corridor.”

Town planners, however, claimed that accidents near the corridors occurred due to lack of enforcement, not because of faulty planning or lesser width of the road. “There is no record of accidents at BRTS. Sikar Road, Ajmer Road and New Sanganer Road were two-laned on either sides (total 4 lanes) when BRTS corridor was constructed. Now, there are three lanes on either side of the corridor. If the corridor is removed, movement of buses along with traffic is expected to cause more accidents,” said the official.

As per the JDA proposal, BRTS along with Jaipur Metro was expected to bring a massive change on the city roads. It was proposed that once the project is operational, the passengers can avail buses in every 10 minutes. Many of these buses were also planned to be linked with Jaipur Metro to make the network strong. But, nothing has been done so far.

Rajul Gupta, a resident of Mansarovar area said, the department has not only wasted public money, but valuable space on roads. “The BRTS runs only on a small route. Also, approximately the 6-km corridor remains defunct on New Sanganer Road as all the low-floor buses ply on its parallel road, the Madhyam Marg. What’s the use of having a corrdior?.”

Agreeing to the fact, a JDA official source said the project would have been feasible if the entire BRTS network was laid. Till date, JDA has constructed 7 km on north-south corridor (Sikar Road) against the sanctioned 26 km. Similarly, against the sanctioned 13 km, only 8 km has been constructed on east-west corridor.

Title: BoM posts profit in 4th straight qtr
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Pune: Bank of Maharashtra posted its fourth straight quarter of net profit, helped by expense control even as gross NPAs inched up in absolute terms. The bank posted a net profit of Rs 135 crore in the quarter ended December 2019 against a loss of Rs 3,764 crore in the year-ago period. Even so, the lender’s gross advances grew 4.8% against an industry average of over 7%.

“The bank has been focusing its lending to the retail, agriculture and MSME segments (which account for about 57% of loans). In the large corporate segment, the bank is lending only to top-rated corporates and is being cautious in the exposure it takes,” said Bank of Maharashtra MD and CEO A S Rajeev.

He said the higher slippages (standard loans going bad) in the quarter were mainly due to two large NBFC accounts — DHFL and Religare. Except for these, he said, the slippages would have been smaller. About Rs 1,328 crore of standard loans turned bad during the quarter.

Also, the bank was able to reduce just about Rs 1,062 crore of bad loans in the quarter — more than half of what it could in the year-ago quarter. The bank has further declared Rs 4,812 crore under the special mention account category of the RBI — meaning it will have to be more watchful on these exposures.

Title: Telangana: Man jailed for sexual assault of daughter
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A man was convicted by a local court in LB Nagar for sexually assaulting his adopted daughter and directed to undergo five years of imprisonment. The offence took place in 2015 and after the 13-year-old victim lodged a complaint, the police charged the convict under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offence (POCSO) Act.

The victim, who is actually a niece of the convict, was adopted by him after her parents passed away. The convict, in absence of his wife, used to sexually abuse the girl and on one occasion, the convict caused an injury on the victim’s wrist.

He was arrested by Ghatkesar police.

Title: High court to hear plea by Chanda Kochhar on February 3
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Chanda Kochhar (File photo)

MUMBAI: A new bench of the Bombay high court will on February 3 hear afresh a petition filed by former ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar to challenge the validity of her termination by the lender.

As assignments changed, her plea to declare the bank’s acceptance of her earlier retirement as valid and not her termination for cause came up on Monday before a new bench of Justices Nitin Jamdar and M S Karnik. The bench posted it for hearing next month.

On Monday morning, ICICI Bank opposed a plea by Kochhar to keep the matter part-heard before the earlier bench of Justices Ranjit More and Surendra Tavade. That bench had in December heard the bank on a preliminary issue of maintainability of her petition.

The bank had sought time to file an affidavit in reply to the petition on merits and the matter was kept for January 13. ICICI Bank filed a reply and also substantial suit against her to return all her emoluments and stock options, running into a huge amount. The suit will be heard separately before a single-judge bench.

Title: Truck carrying copper wires worth Rs 1.59 crore missing
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

Bharuch/Surat: A truck carrying copper wires worth Rs.1.59 crores from the Birla Copper’s Dahej plant is missing since January 9.

A police complaint in this regard was lodged by Ajay Chaudhary, branch manager of Ritu Roadlines at Ankleshwar city police station, against the driver Bhuwarlala Gangaram, resident of Jodhpur in Rajasthan.

Dipak Unadkat, police inspector, Ankleshwar city police station, said, "Birla Copper has given the transportation contract to Ritu Roadlines who in turn have given a subcontract to Mahesh Roadlines . Three trucks were loaded with copper wires on January 8 from Dahej Plant out of which one truck RJ19 GB1044 was carrying 29.033 metric tonnes.”

Unadkat said the material was to delivered in Howrah, West Bengal .

Truck driver Bhuwarlala took Rs 40,000 from the Mahesh Transport's office for expenses and filled diesel from Sarang Petrol pump on National Highway 48 near Ankleshwar on January 9. His mobile location could be seen till January 11 but later, his cell phone was switched off. The truck did not even reach Howrah in West till January 19.

Ritu Roadline owner smelt something fishy and approached the police. CCTV footages showed the truck at Kamrej toll tax plaza on January 11.

Title: Leopard enters house in Nakhatrana village, rescued
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

The leopard inside the house of Devendrasinh Sodha in Godhiar village near Nakhatrana

RAJKOT: When Devendrasinh Sodha opened the door of his house on Monday morning, he was greeted by growling from a leopard . Before the big cat could pounce on him, he ran out of the house and fastened the door from outside. He then called up the forest department and other villagers.

The incident was reported from Godhiar village of Nakhatrana taluka in Kutch district. The incident triggered panic among villagers who gathered around Sodha’s house. Some also recorded video of the leopard roaming inside from outside the window with an iron grill using their mobile phones.

Sources said that there was lot of hue and cry as the moved about in the house.

“We had to shoot the leopard with a tranquillizer dart in order to render it unconscious. Then we pulled out the big cat and took it to the forest department’s shelter in Nakhatrana,” said a forest official.

“We will be releasing the leopard back into the forest once it regains its consciousness,” added the official.

Title: Christians call for unity miracle in times of ‘divisive politics’
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Rallyists at St Paul's Cathedral

KOLKATA: A few thousand Christians walked from St Paul’s Cathedral to the Gandhi statue on Mayo Road on Monday, praying for a miracle to “bring back peace to the strife-torn country”. The procession, organised jointly by the Bangiya Christiya Pariseba and the Bengal Christian Council, united the Church of North India, the Roman Catholic Church , the Methodist, Baptist and AG churches on the citizenship issue.

Bishop Paritosh Canning led the rally dressed in kurta and jeans, steering the growing crowd as it moved in a thick mass negotiating peak-hour traffic. The hour-long rally started at 2pm and included priests of nearly 100 churches from the city and suburbs, some dressed in cassocks, accompanied by their parishioners. Some held up the National Flag while some carried anti-NRC and anti-CAA placards. Some parishioners beat on dhols and others sang kirtans and Bengali hymns.

Once in a while, the rallyists broke into, “we shall overcome”, punctuated by “Jai Jesu, have mercy on the country” as they marched along.

“These are dangerous times and minorities are feeling threatened. We appeal to the King of Peace — Shaantiraaj — Jesus — to send a miracle,” said the Bishop. The Roman Catholic Church was represented by its vicar general, Dominic Gomes. “There is fear all around and the Constitution needs to be protected. Christians have come together in a single voice of protest today,” he said.

Principals and teachers of at least 40 schools in the city also participated in the walk. “The anxiety over CAA and NRC is palpable. Look at what is happening in Assam. Never did the minorities feel so threatened in their lives. Though the Christians have not been targeted as yet, there is no guarantee that they won’t be in future. We fear for our schools too,” said T H Ireland, principal of St James’ School. He stressed that after seven decades of freedom and having successfully run as a secular Republic, it’s sad that divisive politics are ripping India apart.

The chief of Bangiya Christiya Pariseba, Herod Mullick, said that the Christian community was leading a concerted movement against CAA and NRC, and till there is a let up, the movement will grow in momentum. “We are going to submit a memorandum to the governor and the President about what we think,” Ireland said.

“The Anglo Indians, who are all Christians, have lost their reservation in Parliament and the state assemblies. Isn’t this a clear indication that minorities are being targeted one by one? We are a small community, but an influential one. We shall all remain united,” said MLA Shane Calvert.

Title: FPIs cut stake in Infosys, raise in TechM, TCS
Content:
(Representative image)

BENGALURU/MUMBAI: Foreign fund managers have cut their stake in Infosys by 1.7% between September-end and December-end, at a time when two whistleblower complaints hit the software major. In comparison, during the same period, these fund managers increased their stakes by 2.6% in Tech Mahindra and 0.4% in TCS , while in Wipro and HCL Tech their stakes were almost unchanged, latest shareholding analysis of the five IT majors showed.The combined market cap of these five software exporters, at about Rs 15 lakh crore, is around 10% of India’s total market cap.In case of Infosys, while foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) pared their stake during the October-December quarter (Q3), insurance companies hiked their combined stake by 0.7% and mutual funds (MFs) by 0.4%. In TCS, where FPIs bought in Q3, MFs and high net worth investors (HNIs) pared their respective stake marginally, while in Tech Mahindra, MFs and retail investors pared their stakes, while FPIs hiked.Other than in Infosys, there was no significant event relating to the five software export majors that could have impacted the stock price. Rod Bourgeois, head of research at DeepDive Equity Research, said that the whistleblower-related concerns were the main reasons for pressure on Infosys’s stock price during the December quarter, particularly in October. “In our questions on the earnings call, we asked the chairman about employee impacts related to the investigation, and he indicated that the whistleblower was probably not an employee,” Bourgeois said.Although the company said that forensic auditors did not find anything to indicate that its top managers did some financial jugglery to perk up its numbers, FPI fund managers are still cautious. Hugh Young , MD of Asia-Pacific region at Aberdeen Standard Investments, said that there was some concern about the whistleblower issue. “It has been put to rest temporarily at least, though history suggests it might rear its head again,” he said.These changes in non-promoter shareholding in general and by FPIs in particular came at a time when foreign inflows peaked after the government cut corporate tax rates. A report by domestic financial services house Edelweiss pointed out that FPI flows into India hit a five-year high in 2019 with foreign funds being net buyers at $14.8 billion in the primary and secondary equity markets (against a net-buy of $16.2 billion in 2014).“FPIs particularly staged a comeback in the wake of corporate tax rate cuts in 2019, cheering the move by pumping in about $8.2 billion from September 20 through December 2019,” the report said.

Title: Lower duty-free quota to hit high-end brands
Content:
(Representative image)

NEW DELHI: The commerce department’s proposal to halve liquor quota for international flyers to a single one-litre bottle at duty-free shops across the country has had a sobering effect on both wine and spirits makers and airport operators.Apart from having a direct impact on premium liquor sales , the proposed move, senior industry executives said, could hamper test-marketing of new products and sales of high-end boutique brands for both domestic and foreign companies.“Curtailing liquor sales at duty-free shops will have a minuscule effect on the government’s plan to rein in trade deficit. Indian liquor companies are currently producing world-class spirits. Duty-free shops are an important medium for them to showcase premium brands to the right target audience,” said Amar Sinha, COO at Radico Khaitan. Some of the company’s high-end brands such as Rampur Indian Single Malt Whisky and Jaisalmer Indian Craft Gin generate a significant percentage of their sales in duty-free outlets at airports.Most liquor companies have launched duty-free-only products as well. For instance, French company Pernod Ricard sells several products, including Chivas Brothers Blend, The Secret Speyside and Royal Salute-The Time Series ‘52 Year Old’ only through duty-free shops in India.“When new brands are launched, people buy at duty-free if they like it. Duty-free stores are places to experiment, stimulate trials and many brands are launched here,” said Amrit Kiran Singh, executive chairman of International Spirits & Wines Association of India (ISWAI).“Liquor currently accounts for around 80% business at duty-free shops in small cities in India. Airport operators share this revenue with the government. This helps us increase non-aeronautical revenue and keep aero revenue — raised as landing and parking charges from airlines and user fee from flyers — in check. Any move that hurts non-aero revenue will mean a hike in aero revenue and will lead to higher charges for passengers in the form of heftier user fees or airline tariffs,” said a person in the know.Globally, travel retail volume for spirits is estimated to reach around $10.4 billion by 2023, the growth being led by cane spirits, Japanese whisky and gin, according to IWSR (The International Wine and Spirit Research). Some of the top-selling spirits brands in global travel retail include Johnnie Walker Scotch, Jack Daniel’s Whiskey and Chivas Scotch.

Title: Sainik Kalyan Nigam forgery accused held
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

VARANASI: Absconding accused of embezzlement at the Varanasi regional office of UP Purva Sainik Kalyan Nigam Limited (UPPSKNL) was arrested from Robertsganj in Sonbhadra district on Monday.

The accused Sanjay Kumar Verma was carrying a reward of Rs 10,000,

According to reports, Verma, a resident of Nirala Nagar colony, worked as an accountant at the Varanasi office of UPPSKNL. He, along with three others, including Mahendra Pratap Singh (accountant), Devbrat Rai (clerk) and Ravindra Kumar (computer operator) embezzled around Rs two crore by forgery and cheating.

An FIR was registered against the three at Cantt police station under sections 409 (criminal breach of trust by public servant), 419 (cheating by personation), 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property), 406 (criminal breach of trust), 407 (sriminal breach of trust by carrier, etc), 468 (forgery for purpose of cheating), 471 (using as genuine a forged document or electronic record), and 120B (criminal conspiracy) of IPC in 2019.

While other accused are in jail, Verma, who was out on bail, went absconding. Acting on a tip-off, the crime team of Cantt police nabbed him at Vikas Nagar in Robertsganj. During interrogation, Verma revealed that he was hiding at his sister’s place in Robertrsganj. After arrest, the police brought him to Varanasi.

Title: Stage set for royal’s grand coronation
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Ranjit Vilas Palace where the coronation ceremony will take place

RAJKOT: Two world records will be set during the three-day coronation ceremony of Thakorsaheb Mandhatasinh Jadeja, the 17th king of erstwhile princely state of Rajkot.

During the ceremony, scheduled to start amid much fanfare from January 27, more than 2,500 women will participate in ‘talwar raas’ or sword dancing and attempt a world record on January 28. So far, the world record in talwar raas (sword dance) consisted of 2,000 women.

The second record will attempted when Ranjit Vilas Palace gets illuminated with 7,000 earthen lamps on January 29. The lamps will be placed in the formation of royal insignia of the erstwhile Rajkot state.

“In the afternoon of January 28, Thakorsaheb Mandhatasinh Jadeja will be taking out a procession in which the kings of 96 erstwhile princely states including 58 from Saurashtra, Kutch and Gujarat and 38 from Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Kashmir, Chhattisgarh, Uttar Pradesh, Odisha, Maharashtra, Himachal Pradesh, Tripura and Andhra Pradesh will take part,” said yuvraj (prince) Jaideepsinh Jadeja, son of Thakorsaheb Mandhatasinh Jadeja.

“In the past 200 years, this is for the first time that a coronation ceremony on such a grand scale is going to happen in Gujarat. The coronation will be performed as per the Hindu rituals,” said acharya Kaushik Trivedi, who will preside over the ceremony.

“There will be water brought from 31 holy rivers for the ‘jalabhishek’ (water offering) ceremony. More than 100 spices of plants will be offered in the yagna (holy fire),” added Trivedi.

Title: Navin Dewaji to be the new CEO of Siemens Gamesa
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Chennai: Navin Dewaji will be the new country CEO of Siemens Gamesa, the market leader in India in terms installed wind energy capacity. He will be taking over from Ramesh Kymal, who after stepping down will pursue new professional challenges.

Kymal will stay in Siemens Gamesa until the end of April to support Dewaji, ensuring a smooth transition after the new CEO joins in March, a statement from the company said.

“I am joining a team that has done an outstanding job over the past years, building a leading business and contributing to the sustainable development of India by delivering clean, affordable and reliable energy to the communities,” said Navin Dewaji. He will report to the Onshore chief regions officer (CRO) Enrique Pedrosa.

Siemens Gamesa is the market leader in India with more than 6.2 GW installed capacity, since it started operating in the country, in 2009. According to GWEC India is ranked 4th in global wind power installed capacity.

The onshore potential in the country is promising as it stands at 300 GW of which only 35 GW have been tapped. India’s government has established a target of reaching 65 GW of cumulative wind power capacity by 2022.

Title: NCLT orders liquidation of Nathella Sampath Jewellery
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Chennai: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has ordered liquidation of Nathella Sampath Jewellery, which downed its shutters in 2017. The insolvency was admitted in May 2018 following a voluntary petition filed by the company. The jeweller owes Rs 461.4 crore to 58 financial creditors and 62 operational creditors and an additional Rs 63.7 crore as advance received from customers for future purchases, which have to be returned.

The NCLT appointed resolution professional Ram Ratan Kanoongo said it has been difficult to find a resolution for the revival of the jewellery chain and the committee of lenders had recommended liquidation with 97.9% voting in favour.

“The deadline of 330 days expired in November 2019, but there are multiple proceedings pending. We were hence constrained to call for liquidation,” he further said, according to the statement.

Prior to initiating resolution process, the Enforcement Directorate also attached Rs 328 crore worth assets under the the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

The tribunal further added that ordering liquidation will not have any bearing on the PMLA (Prevention of Money Laundering Act 2002) proceedings, because action against erring management will not be affected by the order. The order also noted that a liquidation professional must be appointed and Kanoongo will act as liquidator until such time.

Title: India Skills contests see 16k participants
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Children hogged the limelight by simply displaying their creativity and dexterity in the exciting district-level competitions of India Skills Kerala 2020 , which concluded on Monday.

The first round of the multi-tier India Skills Kerala 2020 competitions, being organized by the industrial training department (ITD) and Kerala Academy for Skills Excellence (KASE), both under the labour and skills department, concluded in all the 14 districts across the state.

Around 16, 000 contestants turned up for the event hosted by government ITIs across the state. Labour and excise minister T P Ramakrishnan inaugurated the district-level competitions in the capital city on January 15.

Skills such as floristry and fashion technology, which demand a sound aesthetic sense and dexterity, witnessed larger participation from girls. The district-level competitions, will be followed by zonal events in Thiruvananthapuram, Kochi and Kozhikode between January 27 and January 31. The state-level finale is scheduled from February 22 to 24, at Swapna Nagari, Kozhikode. The winners will get Rs1 lakh each as prize.

The state-level winners will qualify for the national competition and the prize-winning performers at the national round will get an opportunity to represent the country at World Skills 2021 in Shanghai, China.

The categories of competitions include 3-D digital game art, auto body repair, automobile technology, bakery, beauty therapy, brick laying, CNC milling, CNC turning, cabinet making, car painting, carpentry, cloud computing, cooking, cyber security, electrical installations, electronics, fashion technology, floristry, graphic design technology, hair dressing, health and social care, hotel reception, IT network system administration, IT software solutions for business, jewellery, joinery, landscape gardening, mechanical engineering CAD, mobile robotics, painting and decorating, patisserie and confectionery, plastering and drywall system, plastic die engineering, plumbing and heating, print media technology, among others.

Title: Bihar: Schoolchildren all praise for PM’s ‘Pariksha Pe Charcha’
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

PM Narendra Modi

PATNA: Altogether 70 students from Bihar , including 22 Patnaites, participated in the third edition of ‘ Pariksha Pe Charcha ’ at Talkatora stadium in New Delhi on Monday and got tips from Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi on how to prepare for board and competitive exams.

Those, who could not attend the event, raised questions through video messages. Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya (Bihar) student Juli Sagar asked, “How can we realize our inner potential?” To this, the PM said, “In order to understand our inner potential, we need to come out of our comfort zones and break our protective shells. Above all, we should understand what activity gives us inner happiness.”

Sharing her experience of taking part in ‘Pariksha Pe Charcha’, Navya Ranjan, a class IX student of Open Minds - A Birla School, told this newspaper, “PM Modi explained everything in a friendly manner and laid stress on the fact that an exam is just a phase of life. He also told us to accept failure and use it as a motivation, instead of getting sad or depressed.”

Meanwhile, the teachers and students of city schools like Kendriya Vidyalaya and St Michael’s High School watched the live telecast of the event.

Gautam Singh, a Michaelite, said, “I am not just relaxed, but also determined to perform well in my upcoming board exam. I have decided not to take unnecessary stress.”

Another student, Hansika of Notre Dame Academy, said, “After listening to the PM, I feel so relaxed. I could never get better guidance.”

Carmel High School’s Class XII student Juhi went all praise for the PM’s speech. “He asked the students of classes X and XII to spend some time on extracurricular activities. He was right because only we understand the pressure we have to go through every day. The idea of taking a break from time to time is helpful,” she said.

During the event, the PM also advised parents to find out what their children want to do, instead of pushing them to indulge in something that they do not like.

Inspired by the speech, Mukul Agarwal, a father of two children, claimed, “Everybody in my family, including me, studied medical. I wanted my daughter to become a doctor too, but I think I should try to understand where her interest lies.”

Ashok Rajpath resident Chandra Kanta said, “We always want our children to become something we could not be. I think it’s high time we focused on their dreams.”

Title: Bihar: Sunny days, cold mornings to prevail
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Girls wearing woolen clothes during cold and foggy weather in Patna

PATNA: Most parts of Bihar , including Patna, are set to witness warmer days henceforth, except for a couple of days around January 25 when the maximum temperature is expected to plunge below 20 degrees Celsius due to change in wind direction, the Patna meteorological centre said on Monday.

As of now, meteorologists expect dry weather to prevail in the state till January 24 and winter conditions till the end of this month. Mornings will continue to be cold as the minimum temperature is likely to remain in the range of 9-10 degrees C. Low minimum temperature is expected to be accompanied by fog cover in the morning hours.

Minimum and maximum temperatures in Patna on Monday was recorded at 9.8 degrees C and 20 degrees C respectively. Gaya was the coldest place in state with the minimum temperature recorded at 6.6 degrees C.

The weatherman said people will have to bear with cold conditions despite sunny days , primarily due to cold westerly winds. “Cold westerly winds were blowing at an average speed of 9-13kmph in the lower level of atmosphere on Monday and any change in wind direction is unlikely till January 24,” said a senior official at Patna meteorological centre.

The daily weather bulletin issued stated that a western disturbance is very likely to affect western Himalayan region from January 24 onwards. Western disturbances are low pressure area or extratropical storms originating from the Mediterranean Sea, Red Sea and Caspian Sea, which cause snow and winter rainfall in northwestern Indian subcontinent.

According to Skymet Weather, the approaching western disturbance is last strong western disturbance of the season and it was most likely to hit the western Himalayas by Monday evening. As a result, scattered rain or snow was expected in parts of Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh and Himachal Pradesh by Monday night. It further stated that the weather was expected to start clearing up from the hills as well as northern plains from January 22 onwards.

The local Met centre, however, denied making any prediction about the impact of the approaching western disturbance on weather conditions in Bihar. “We will have to see if any cyclonic circulation forms over Rajasthan and whether a trough line forms in the region before making any forecast for showers under the influence of the approaching western disturbance. It will be bit early to make any such forecast at present,” an official at Patna meteorological centre said.

New director takes charge at Patna Meteorological Centre: Vivek Sinha, scientist-F, took charge as the new director of Patna meteorological centre on Monday. Sinha was earlier posted at India Meteorological Department’s headquarters in New Delhi.

Title: Differences of opinion come to the fore at Park Circus as one group reaches out to governor
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

School students form a human chain at Park Circus on Monday morning to protest against CAA, NPR and NRC

KOLKATA: Differences in opinion between two groups have surfaced at the Park Circus sit-in against CAA and NRC on who will be the face of the protest and take the leadership role on deciding daily activities. While a group, led by social worker Asmat Jamil from Ripon Street, has claimed that she was the “organizer of dharna at Park Circus”, another group led by Uzma Alam, a homemaker and activist, alleged that things were being “controlled” at the protest venue by a handful of people. Disagreements had peaked on Saturday when there was a public spat between the two groups. On Monday, while members of one group met governor Jagdeep Dhankhar , requesting him to convey to the central government the public outrage over CAA and NRC, members of the other group distanced themselves from the visit and termed it an “attempt to create havoc among peaceful protesters”.

Every day for the past few days, thousands, including students and homemakers, have been thronging the venue to express their solidarity with the cause and the protesters.

“I am the organizer of the dharna. I came here with seven women and sat here on the night of January 7. Others joined in after that. As long as all of us are protesting against CAA and NRC, people have the freedom to give their ideas and volunteer,” said Jamil.

Alam, however, said, “It is a democratic protest, but Jamil and her people are not letting others express themselves. When I said I have got an appointment with the governor, they said I was colluding with the BJP. On many occasions, the governor has said he is the head of the state and is always open to dialogue, which is why we decided to approach him.”

Alam met the governor on Monday afternoon along with representatives of four organisations and said he had assured them of all help.

“We presented a memorandum to the governor, apprising him of the situation and how CAA and the proposed NRC threaten to tear apart the secular fabric of the country. He assured us that he will look into the matter,” said Alam, who was earlier associated with the Calcutta Muslim Orphanage.

“I have not allowed any political person at the dharna because we want it to be a neutral movement. Several students have been coming here to support us every day,” said Jamil, adding, “I have not been keeping well, but I could not stop myself when the CAA was passed in Parliament because I want to save my Constitution. I have been involved social work for more than a decade, but I have never publicised my work.”

A volunteer who has been visiting Park Circus since the beginning of the protest, and has organized activities to mobilise support and break the monotony, said several activities had to be postponed or cancelled due to disagreement between the two groups.

Title: Rising prices & crude, weak Q3 results weigh on sensex
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

MUMBAI: An increasing benchmark yield due to the rising consumer inflation, which in December hovered near the 7.5% mark, along with the not-so-enthusiastic quarterly numbers and spiking crude oil prices weighed on investor sentiment on Monday.

This pulled the sensex down by 1% at close. The index, after touching a new all-time peak at 42,274 in early trade, closed with a loss of 416 points at 41,529. Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank , Kotak Bank and TCS accounted for most of the sensex’s loss, BSE data showed.

Religare Broking VP (research) Ajit Mishra said the market witnessed selling pressure despite positive global cues, mainly because of disappointing earnings numbers by select Nifty majors. “We continue to remain cautious on the markets, given that the indices are near their peak levels. The expectations from the Budget are high this time around, given the current economic slowdown. This is likely to drive momentum across sectors,” he said.

The day’s session was also impacted by rising crude oil prices, which went past the $65-per-barrel level after supply disruptions were reported from Iran and Libya, both major crude producers. Given the weak economic conditions in India, any rise in crude prices is expected to have a negative impact on the country’s trade numbers, economists say.

In the bond market, the benchmark yield on the 10-year government securities went near the 6.70% mark, up from 6.50% last week after December’s consumer inflation jumped to 7.35% due to galloping food prices, analysts said. Since the benchmark yield is one of the main determinants of the lending rates by banks, this could put pressure on banks to hike lending rates. A rising inflation reading will also hold back the RBI from cutting rates immediately, hurting the economic condition in the country, economists said. All these factors also weighed on investor sentiment on Dalal Street, traders said.

The day’s selling was led by domestic funds, which recorded a net outflow figure of Rs 1,420 crore while foreign funds were net buyers at just Rs 6 crore. Of the 30 sensex stocks, 20 closed in the red.

Title: Three killed in bus-truck collision near Bharuch
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Three passengers were killed and 20 injured when the luxury bus they were travelling in collided with a truck near Vadadla village of Nabipur taluka in Bharuch district on National Highway (NH)-8 on Monday morning.

The bus (GJ-14-X-5295) left Surat for Ahmedabad on early Monday morning when it met with the accident near Vadadla village. The speeding bus rammed into the truck, which was taking a U-turn on the highway.

The deceased were identified as Jashi Chavda (42), a resident of Hira Baug in Varachha, Manish Joshi (40) and Prakash Gorasiya (31), both residents of Bhavnagar.

According to the complaint lodged by Magan Chavda (48), who is the husband of Jashi, they had boarded the bus from the Hirabaug Circle in Varachha on early Monday morning to travel to Ahmedabad. The driver of the bus did not noticed the truck, which was taking a U-turn, and rammed into it.

“My wife received serious head injuries and died on the spot,” said Chavda in his complaint.

The driver of the bus, whose identity could not be ascertained, abandoned the vehicle and fled from the spot. He was booked for rash driving and causing the deaths of three passengers. The bus was owned by Raviraj Travels in Surat.

Title: Kerala: Congress suspends Gracy Joseph
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Gracy Joseph

KOCHI: In a face-saving exercise, Ernakulam District Congress Committee (DCC) has suspended corporation development standing committee chairperson Gracy Joseph , who defied the diktat of the leadership to quit the chairperson’s post. According to sources with the Congress, the party is exploring the possibilities of moving no-confidence motion against Joseph so as to expel her from the chairperson’s post.

It was as part of a plan for change of guard at the helm of the corporation that the leadership asked four standing committee chairpersons belonging to the Congress to step down. Of the four, town planning standing committee chairperson Shiny Mathew, tax appeal standing committee chairman KVP Krishna Kumar and welfare standing committee chairman A B Sabu resigned. But Joseph didn’t obey the instruction of the party leadership.

In the council with a total strength of 74, UDF has 37 members and LDF enjoys the support of 34. BJP has two members while a seat is vacant after T J Vinod, who was the deputy mayor, got elected to the state assembly.

The rift in the Congress in the corporation is widening with most of the councillors and leaders demanding the resignation of mayor Soumini Jain. According to them, there was an understanding for sharing the post of mayor between Jain and Shiny Mathew for two-and-a-half years each. But Jain refused to quit the post. She said she would quit if all other standing committee chairpersons quit. With the removal of Joseph, pressure will again mount on Jain to quit. But those close to Jain said she wouldn’t step down. With only seven months left for the elections to the local bodies, changing the mayor would cause damage to UDF, those supporting Jain argues.

Title: Groom’s father & bride’s mother ‘elope’, wedding called off in Gujarat
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: In Bollywood super hit 'Hum Aapke Hain Kaun ,' groom Mohnish Behl's uncle Alok Nath and the bride Renuka Shahane's mother Rima Lagoo are put in a comically awkward situation when Nath's college-days crush on her is revealed by none other than Lagoo's husband Anupam Kher. All relish this harmless disclosure with laughs and the marriage passes off smoothly.

In Surat, however, marriage plan of two youngsters was shattered after the groom's father and the bride's mother revived their young days’ love and both reportedly fled. The marriage was scheduled in February second week, but the 48-year-old man and the 46-year-old woman, are nowhere to be found for 10 days now.

While the man disappeared from his house in Katargam area, the woman left her house in Navsari . It is strongly suspected that they have eloped, leaving the families in an extremely embarrassing situation. Both families have filed missing persons’ report with the police.

The bride and groom were preparing for their marriage for the past one year after they got engaged. They are from the same community and elders were taken in confidence before their engagement was done. However, the elopement barely a month before the marriage has left everyone shocked.

The groom’s father, Rakesh, (name changed), a textile businessman who also deals in property, went untraceable around January 10. Rakesh, who is also a member of a political party, is a native of Amreli district. He knew the bride’s mother, Swati (name changed), since their young age. They were neighbours in Katargam area and were good friends too, it is reliably learnt.

“They knew each other since they lived in same society. Some of their close friends informed us after they eloped that they had a relationship in the past too. However, Swati got engaged with her current husband in Navsari,” said a relative of both the families.

Swati, whose family hails from Bhavnagar district , got married to a diamond artisan who later became broker.

The elopement has become a point of discussion on social media and photos of the couple are being widely shared.

Read this story in Bengali

Title: 2011 Dumas gang rape accused nabbed from Faridabad
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

Title: Bihar: One ration card scheme from June 1
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Ram Vilas Paswan

PATNA: Union minister of consumer affairs, food and public distribution Ram Vilas Paswan on Monday said the Centre would implement its ‘ One Nation One Ration Card ’ scheme across the country from June 1.

Talking to media here, Paswan said the facility of interstate or national portability of ration card had already been provided in 12 states from January 1 this year. This facility would be extended to eight more states by June to cover around 63 crore beneficiaries of foodgrains under the National Food Security Act (NFSA).

“Except few hilly regions in the northeastern states where e-POS (electronic Point of Sale) machines are not fully functional, the interstate or intra-state portability of ration card would be available across the country from June 1,” he said.

Under the scheme, any eligible beneficiary will be able to get his/her entitled foodgrain under the NFSA from any public distribution or fair price shop in the country using the same ration card. The beneficiary will be verified through Aadhaar authentication on the e-POS devices.

“This facility would not be available at a PDS shop where e-POS device is not available or not connected to the interstate portability network,” Paswan said, adding around 35 crore beneficiaries under the NFSA have already been covered under the scheme in 12 states.

The 12 states where interstate portability is available are Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Kerala, Karnataka, Haryana, Rajasthan, Tripura, Goa, Jharkhand and Madhya Pradesh, he said.

To a question, Paswan said Bihar would hopefully be linked to the ‘one nation one ration card ’ platform by March 31 this year. He said the process of automation of around 46,800 PDS shops has been completed in Bihar.

He said the process of intra-state portability of ration card has already begun in 16 states and the facility is fully operational in 12 states namely Andhra Pradesh, Haryana, Karnataka, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Telangana, Tripura, Gujarat, Jharkhand and Punjab, while it is partially operational in states like Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Odisha and Chhattisgarh. Under the intra-state portability, an eligible beneficiary can avail foodgrain from any district in his/her state.

Paswan also said around 3 crore fake ration cards across the country were scrapped from the government records during the process of de-duplication of cards through Aadhaar number seeding. In Bihar, around 44,400 fake ration cards were scrapped.

Title: Bihar: Veer Kunwar Singh’s sword to be displayed at four places in Bhojpur
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

The proposed ‘Vijay Stambh’

PATNA: The sword of freedom fighter, Veer Kunwar Singh , which had vanquished the British soldiers in the 1857 rebellion, will soon shine atop high platforms at four places in Bhojpur district.

The work on construction of the platforms, christened ‘Vijay Stambh’, is in progress and they are likely to be ready by the end of February. In the meantime, the authorities concerned are waiting for the arrival of consignment of the swords being cast at Jaipur in Rajasthan.

Bhojpur district magistrate (DM) Roshan Kushwaha told this newspaper that the Bihar State Tourism Development Corporation (BSTDC) had identified four places — Kayam Nagar, Bibiganj, Buzurg and Sheopur Ghat — where specially-designed swords of Veer Kunwar Singh would be displayed.

"The Vijay Stambh’ will be an epitome of the bravery of the great freedom fighter. It will also give a boost to tourism in Bhojpur,” the DM said.

He added, “According to historical texts, it was at Sheopur Ghat that Kunwar Singh drew his sword and cut off his hand after being injured by the bullets of the British Army. Hence, this place was chosen for one of the victory pillars.”

BSTDC’s executive engineer Ramashakar Prasad said, “The base of the 15-foot-high ‘Vijay Stambh’ will be 50 feet long and 50 feet wide. A 21-foot-long bronze sword will be installed on top of the pillar and the ground will have green grasses. The entire area will be protected by boundary walls.”

Shashikant Tripathi, a social activist of Kayam Nagar, claimed that a thick wall near a river in the village was believed to be part of the ruined camp of Kunwar Singh. “The new victory pillar is being built at a little distance from that site and will help attract tourists,” he said.

Title: Patna: 4-hour snarl hits schoolkids, patients
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Many people remained stuck in the jam for hours

PATNA: Several prominent areas of the city faced severe traffic congestion from 12pm to 4pm on Monday. Many people remained stuck in the jam for hours, but the worst affected were schoolchildren and patients in ambulances , who could not move ahead.

The stretch from Rajapur Pul to Golghar, Bailey Road, Income Tax Roundabout, Beerchand Patel Path, Ashiana-Digha Road, Boring Road, Chiraiyatand Bridge, Bander Bagicha and Daroga Prasad Rai Path came to a standstill due to traffic congestion.

“Many people came to attend the ‘Maharana Pratap Smriti Samaroh’ from across the state and parked their vehicles on the road. This led to slow traffic movement. Besides, a large number of horses, which were roped in for the event, added to the traffic woes,” a traffic cop told TOI.

The commuters, however, blamed poor traffic management for the snarls. “It is the duty of the district administration to ensure that commuters do not face such problems,” said Prabhat Kumar, who was stuck in traffic near the I-T roundabout and was unable to park his car in Maurya Lok Complex where he had gone shopping with his family.

Chanchala Kumari, who teaches in a BEd college at Bihta, missed her train because she was stuck in Phulwarisharif area for over an hour.

Kankarbagh resident Mihir Jha also complained about heavy traffic on Chiraiyatand Bridge. He said, “I usually cross the bridge in five minutes, but today I was there for thirty minutes.”

Rajeev Nagar resident Jitendra Kumar, who was going to Ashiana-Digha Road, saw two ambulances stuck in the jam for an hour.

Meanwhile, traffic SP D Amarkesh said there was no traffic mismanagement. “Thousands of vehicles had come to the city from outside for an event. That led to congestion,” he added.

Title: Bihar: Magadh University, PPU to get 12 assistant professors of Urdu
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

GAYA: Twelve assistant professors will shortly be appointed in the postgraduate and undergraduate departments of Urdu in Magadh and Patliputra universities.

Sources said Bihar Public Service Commission has recommended the names of selected candidates for appointment and the VCs and senior officials of the two universities will shortly meet in Patna to work out the division of faculty members.

According to MU VC Prof Rajendra Prasad, appointment of assistant professors of Urdu will shortly be made. “The process is most likely to be finalized this month,” he said.

The BPSC had advertised 17 posts of assistant professor of Urdu in 2014, prior to the establishment of Patliputra University (PPU). Since Patliputra University was carved out of MU in March 2018 and 25 of the 44 constituent and three of the four government-funded minority colleges were tagged with the Patna-based PPU, the posts have to be shared between the two now.

The BPSC has made recommendation for only 12 posts against the 17 advertised. The posts, according to sources, have been slashed at the instance of the state government, which earlier conducted a massive rationalization exercise under which number of posts were revised in accordance with the actual number of students of particular subjects.

Meanwhile, MU is facing acute faculty shortage on account of nearly 60% of the sanctioned posts of teachers lying vacant. On the other hand, it grossly overstaffed in the non-teaching category as the apportionment of nearly 400 non-teaching employees between MU and PPU is yet to be done. The apportionment has to be done in the 55:45 ratio with 55% of the non-teaching employees of the MU headquarters to be transferred to PPU.

Asked about the delay in the relocation of staff, MU registrar Sidnath Prasad Deen said it was for the PPU authorities to explain the inordinate delay in the execution of the apportionment exercise.

When contacted, PPU pro-VC Prof Girish Kumar Chaudhary said the MoU for the apportionment of non-teaching employees was signed long back between the two universities. “The PPU has written several letters to MU authorities for transferring the services of the non-teaching employees as per the provisions of the MoU, but the latter has so far spared only 18 employees,” he said.

Title: Patna’s air quality improves, now in moderate category
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

A student is seen wearing a pollution mask in Patna (File Photo)

PATNA: The air quality of Patna seems to be gradually improving with westerly winds at comparatively higher speed and gradual increase in temperature.

As per the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data, the average air quality index (AQI) of Patna on Monday was 144, putting it in moderate category. Incidentally, the AQI of Patna was measured in the range of 350 to more than 400 during the peak winter period over the last two months.

Track the pollution level in your city

According to a senior official at Bihar State Pollution Control Board (BSPCB), the AQI level measured at Indira Gandhi Science Complex (planetarium) stood at 208, while it was 21 at Sri Krishna Memorial Hall, 121 at Rajdhani Vatika and 100 at BIT-Mesra in Patna monitoring stations.

Attributing climatic conditions as the main factor for the improvement of air quality in the city, BSPCB chairman Ashok Kumar Ghosh said: “Westerly winds blowing at comparatively higher speed over the last two days has led to improvement in city’s AQI to ‘moderate’ category. The western side of Patna is comparatively cleaner than the eastern side of the city.”

He added: “Earlier, the low wind speed was not letting dust particles and other pollutants to disburse. However, with the increase in the velocity, the air quality has improved.”

Ghosh said the city witnessed a rise in temperature after several days and contributed to improvement in the AQI. “If the weather continues to be like this, Patna’s air quality will become better,” he said.

Meanwhile, Patnaites had respite from the severe air quality in the city observed during the peak winter period. Boring Road resident Anuj Verma, who removed his pollution mask while commuting on the road over the last couple of months, said: “I get severe breathing problems whenever the AQI is high. However, I felt a little relief on Monday. The air quality is still bad but at least I am not getting much trouble in breathing.”

Meanwhile, the AQI at Muzaffarpur and Gaya were 184 and 99 respectively.

Title: Sachin Bansal to put $400 million in banking business
Content:
Sachin Bansal (File photo)

BENGALURU: Flipkart co-founder Sachin Bansal has said that he will deploy all the proceeds from the sale of his stake in the e-commerce player into his financial services venture Navi Technologies , which has applied for a universal banking licence with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). The financial services firm has sought the licence through a step-down subsidiary.Bansal could likely invest $400-450 million in the new venture, according to estimates, which will likely make it one of the biggest equity infusions by a promoter into a new financial services venture. “I am putting almost all of mine (money) — that is going to happen in the next few days or weeks, whatever is left after Ola investment. All eggs in one basket,” said Bansal in an interview to TOI, while not commenting on exact numbers. The total amount is likely to be invested in multiple tranches.The 38-year-old IIT-Delhi graduate, who had started Flipkart in 2007, is also adding more heft to his new venture by roping in former RBI director and ICICI Bank top executive Nachiket Mor, who was till recently head of Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation in India. He has also roped in as an adviser Paresh Sukthankar, the former deputy to HDFC Bank CEO Aditya Puri , who had worked at India’s largest private sector lender since its inception in 1994.Bansal had agreed to sell his over 5% stake in Flipkart to US retail giant Walmart in 2018 for about $1 billion, out of which he will get $750-800 million after tax. Out of this, Bansal has invested $300-350 million in companies like ride-hailing major Ola and electric bike maker Ather. He has also put some capital in treasury operations, including debt papers of companies like Piramal Enterprises.According to Bansal, regulators are “very open to new ideas” and the reason why he has applied for a universal licence rather than a small finance bank is that he wants to operate across multiple sectors.“If you think like a consumer tech company rather than a traditional financial services company, you can solve some big problems,” said Bansal. He added that for India to become a $5-trillion economy, the GDP-to-credit ratio has to improve to 100% from the current 57%.Last year, Bansal had acquired microfinance company Chaitanya Rural Intermediation Development Services (CRIDS), whose subsidiary Chaitanya India Fin Credit (CIFCPL) has applied for the banking licence. While Bansal had acquired CRIDS in his personal capacity, he is in the process of moving the investment under Navi Technologies. The last two players to get a universal banking licence in India were IDFC First Bank and Bandhan Bank, who had applied in 2013 along with 23 others and got an in-principle nod after 10-11 months in 2014.“We will keep the smartphone at the centre of consumer experience, rather than an add-on,” Bansal said. He indicated that currently, it’s the other way round with branches being the centre of focus, and mobile apps also crash at the start of the month, underlining how there is a gap in technology capability at big players. While Chaitanya will continue to focus on the lower end of the market, Bansal also plans to launch a new product under the Navi brand, which will focus on digital lending for the middle-class.Banking through digital channels has been growing at a record pace. According to RBI data, from September 2018 to October 2019, retail digital transactions by value saw a jump of 21% at Rs 302 lakh crore compared to around Rs 250 crore in a year-ago period. Bansal is also in the process of acquiring DHFL Insurance and Essel Mutual Fund to develop plays in the insurance and asset management plays.Both deals are yet to receive regulatory approvals. Bansal said that Navi will raise additional capital from three-four outside investors, including World Bank arm IFC, which is investing $30 million at a valuation of $650-700 million, as TOI reported on January 10. In total, Bansal could be raising $150-200 million from outside investors, according to two sources, though Bansal declined to comment on numbers.“We are looking for people who bring that expertise (financial services). IFC is definitely one of those names. In the 1980s, they were the first investor in HDFC, not the bank but HDFC Ltd. They were investors in almost all the banks who got a licence. So, they have tremendous experience in building banks, not just in India but outside India also. Not just banks but for insurance companies, stock markets in Africa. So, that’s a great set of capabilities we get access to,” he added.

Title: Kotak Bank net profit up 23%, growth slows down
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Mumbai: Kotak Mahindra Bank has reported a net profit of Rs 1,595 crore for the quarter ended December 2019 — an increase of 23% over Rs 1,290 crore in the same period of the previous year.

During this quarter, profits were contained because of a one-time employee cost towards pension obligation of Rs 200 crore. Dipak Gupta, joint MD of the bank, said the lender had to set aside additional funds towards pension for employees of erstwhile ING Vysya Bank. Kotak Bank has 2,000 serving employees and 3,000 retired staff, who are eligible for pension. “We had to deposit more funds after LIC reduced the returns under its annuity to 6.9% from 7.9%,” said Gupta.

The bank’s net interest income (NII) for Q3FY20 rose to Rs 3,430 crore from Rs 2,926 crore in Q3FY19, up 17%. Net interest margin (NIM) for Q3FY20 was at 4.69%, up from 4.31% in Q3FY19. At the end of the quarter, the bank’s advances rose 9% to Rs 2.13 lakh crore from Rs 1.96 lakh crore in the corresponding quarter of previous year. Deposits grew 12% to Rs 2.39 lakh crore from Rs 2.13 lakh crore a year ago.

“There is only so much that we can grow our loans, when the economy is growing a nominal rate of 7-8%,” said Gupta. He cautioned against growing unsecured loans stating risks play out only after a couple of years. He added that defaults could rise sharply in this segment if there were job losses.

On consolidated basis, the profit increased 27% to Rs 2,349 crore as compared to Rs 1,844 crore in the same period a year ago. Total income rose to Rs 13,542 crore from Rs 11,347 crore in the third quarter of FY19. Gross non-performing assets (NPAs) at the quarter-end rose to 2.46% of the total advances as compared with 2.07% at the end of the third quarter of FY19. Net NPAs too increased to 0.89% of the assets in October-December 2019, against 0.71% a year ago.

Title: Ashok Leyland invests Rs 500cr in new platform and BS6 transition
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Chennai: Ashok Leyland is investing around Rs 500 crore on a new platform as well the transition to BS6. This includes around Rs 300 to Rs 350 crore on the new modular platform on which it plans to roll out its BS6 range, said a top company official.

“Ashok Leyland is bringing a completely new platform for BS6,” said company COO Anuj Kathuria. “BS6 requires more complex electricals and electronics and the new platform will allow us to position every aggregate in an optional way,” he added. The new platform has been developed ‘indigenously’. The truck and bus maker, will stop producing BS4 vehicles from February and will only make them based on specific customer requirements in an effort to keep inventory levels manageable in the run up to BS6 migration.

“From February onwards, BS4 models will only be made to order,” said Kathuria. “Our BS4 pipeline is very manageable and we’re not in a position where we will have to push BS4 stock. We will continue producting BS4 vehicles depending on specific customer requirements.”

With BS4 vehicle registration stopping on March 31, any leftover aggregates will have several option of being cleared out. “We will use them to cater to after market requirements and to service export markets that are not yet BS6 compliant,” said Kathuria. “Our entire supply chain is being streamlined as is our distribution network,” he added. Ashok Leyland’s BS6 range, will use a combination of iEGR (intelligent exhaust gas recirculation) and SCR (selective catalytic reduction) for India’s largely stop-and-go traffic.

Title: HC lets Wadia drop suit against Tatas
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Mumbai: The Bombay high court on Monday allowed industrialist Nusli Wadia to withdraw a civil defamation suit he had filed in 2017 against Ratan Tata and Tata Sons . A bench of Justice G S Kulkarni disposed of the suit for damages filed by Wadia as withdrawn. The supreme court had last week granted permission to Wadia to withdraw the suit before the Bombay HC.

Title: Maharana Pratap’s statue to be installed in Patna: CM Nitish Kumar
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar

PATNA: CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said a statue of Maharana Pratap would be installed in the state capital.

Addressing a public meeting organized at the Miller School ground to remember Maharana Pratap on his death anniversary, Nitish said, “We will be doing all the necessary works to honour our illustrious personalities. We have done several works for development of all sections of the society. We have done development works in all regions of the state and for all strata of the society with our resolve to do ‘development with justice’. Several schemes have been launched to bring the disadvantaged sections to the mainstream of the society.”

Earlier, JD(U) spokesperson and former MLC Sanjay Singh demanded installation of a statue of Maharana Pratap in the state capital.

CM further called upon people to follow the path shown by the Maharana to ensure justice to all and peace and togetherness in the society.

Recalling the great valour of the hero of Haldighati, Nitish said Maharana Pratap engaged in long and intermittent fight against the then Mughal regime, but it could be possible because he took people from all sections of the society along with him. The Maharana gave due respect to the people from minorities and tribal communities and they supported him in his war against the Mughals. Members of Dalit Bhangar community were inducted in his army.

The CM also assured the audience to do what he can to help the jailed former MP Anand Mohan.

Other prominent leaders who addressed the event and recalled the contributions of Maharana Pratap were JD(U) state president Bashishtha Narain Singh, Lok Sabha member Rajiv Ranjan Singh, science and technology minister Jai Kumar Singh, building construction minister Ashok Choudhary, water resources minister Sanjay Jha, rural development minister Shravan Kumar, I&PRD minister Neeraj Kumar and former minister Lesie Singh.

Yuva JD(U) spokesperson Om Prakash Singh Setu proposed a vote of thanks.

Title: Betel nuts worth Rs 1.25 crore seized in Bihar
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARPUR: The Central Excise and Customs Department sleuths recovered betel nuts worth over Rs 1.25 crore from two trucks near Maithi toll plaza on NH-57 under Gaighat police station late Sunday evening.

The trucks were intercepted at Jarang village, around 100 metres from the toll plaza. Sources said the trucks were coming from Nepal and had crossed the border near Jainagar in Madhubani district. The consignment was being smuggled from Myanmar and Vietnam, sources said.

Deputy commissioner (customs) Sunil Kumar Gautam said two persons were detained in this connection. “We got some specific information about the trucks bearing the registration numbers of Nagaland. The trucks were laden with betel nuts and on way to Patna. We detained the drivers and cleaners of the trucks, but they were released on personal bond after interrogation. They have given us some vital clues about the illegal trade. They have also revealed the names of few men involved in this trade,” he said, adding that the estimated marked value of the consignment is more than Rs1.25 crore.

“The drivers and cleaners of the trucks were quizzed at our Patna office. They said they were given a mobile number of a person in Patna. But, that number is switched off,” said Gautam.

Title: Presidency University: CAA stir marks 203rd Founders’ Day programme
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Theatre personality Bibhas Chakraborty writes on the board set up to collect signatures against CAA, NRC and N... Read More

KOLKATA: Veteran theatre personality Bibhas Chakraborty, who was the chief guest at the Founders’ Day celebrations at Presidency University on Monday, said there should be a “gana vote”, “plebiscite” or “referendum” before a law like the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ) and the proposed National Population Register ( NPR ) and National Register of Citizens ( NRC ) are implemented. He was speaking on the sidelines of the institution’s 203rd Founders’ Day celebrations on the College Street campus.

“Gana vote hok (let there be mass voting on this issue), plebiscite hok, referendum hok. A law like CAA cannot be passed without consulting the citizens. There should have been wider consultations with the people of the country before such a law was even formulated. After all, it impacts all of us,” the former Presidency student said.

“We have been protesting from various forums and will continue to do so. They claim that they have won with 38% vote of the people of this country. But, so what? A democracy does not function like this. Somebody getting 38% vote cannot decide the fate of the entire country. It is just like partition, where some people sitting in Delhi decided to divide the country and millions were displaced overnight. What is happening now in India is similar to that. Let there be a referendum,” he said.

Chakraborty, along with several other former students, put their names on a board set up by the students to collect signatures against CAA, NRC and NPR.

Former home secretary of Bengal Prasad Ranjan Ray said the opposition parties in the country had failed to put up resistance against CAA and NRC.

“I don’t comment on political matters, but this issue has forced me to voice my concerns. We don’t know on what trajectory this will take the country. For my generation, it is impossible to provide the sort of legacy documents that are needed. I feel the opposition parties are unable to unite and stand against this,” he added.

Title: UP: Three held with ganja worth Rs 6 lakh in Mirzapur
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Arrested miscreants in Mirzapur

VARANASI: Three members of an inter-state gang of drug peddlers were arrested in Adalhat area of Mirzapur district on Monday. The police recovered one quintal ganja worth Rs six lakh and seized two vehicles being used in smuggling.

According to reports, during a checking drive the police stopped a jeep and a car near Baraipur gate and recovered 32 packets of ganja hidden in the cavities in both the vehicles. The police seized the vehicle and booked the arrested persons including Gopi Singh, Chhedi Lal and Manoj Kumar Rajbhar under NDPS Act.

During interrogation, they revealed that they used to smuggle drugs from Odisha for supplying in Varanasi, Prayagraj and Jaunpur districts.

Four held with ganja: Mughalsarai police in Chandauli district arrested four member of a drug peddling gang including a woman with 54 kg of ganja worth Rs eight lakh.

SP Chandauli Hemant Kutiyal said that inspector Mughalsarai Shivanand Mishra, along with his team, was carrying out a checking drive near Padao crossing on Monday morning when they nabbed the four with the consignment of ganja.

The arrested peddlers were identified as Ankur Singh Patel, Ezaz Ahmad alias Sonu, Munna Sahani and Lilavati. Kutiyal said that Ankur and Ezaz are members of the notorious Babar gang of Varanasi. Several criminal cases are lodged against Ankur in Varanasi and Chandauli. Ankur is also in the list of most wanted 10 criminals of Varanasi.

Title: Ajmer: JLN Hospital to get new building
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

AJMER: JLN Hospital here will get an eight-floor floor medicine block with ultra modern facilities where 20 doctors will be able to examine patients at a time in the OPD. This project will cost around Rs 39 crore. A block will be spread over an area of 13,500 square-metres.

According to project details, there will be adequate patient waiting area where more than 200 seats will be provided and 20 doctors will able to see patients at a time. There will also be 317 extra beds for indoor patients and an ICU for 40 patients. Officials said the building will be fully air-conditioned.

JLN Hospital is the main hospital in Ajmer division where patients from Nagaur, Bhilwara and Tonk are referred and therefore need more space for patients. The new building will also have 18 private rooms with 259 beds. The project will also include parking for 40 four-wheelers and 30 two-wheelers.

This building will have fire exists, automatic fire detection system and sprinklers. There will also be three separate stretcher lifts for indoor patients. Lights will also have sensors for energy efficiency. Officials said with this new building, the hospital will get better space for doctors and patients.

Title: Soon, a major facelift for Airport-Chackai Road
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The six-km road from the domestic terminal (T1) of Trivandrum International Airport to Chackai Junction will get a facelift soon as Rs 13 crore has been approved for the project.

The road, which will also pass through one of the entrance gates of the international terminal (T2), will be developed in international standards, giving aesthetic elements equal prominence as for other components like standard ducts for cables, disabled-friendly footpaths and proper pedestrian crossing points.

The road has been conceived as a ‘waste-free zone’ in a bid to address concerns regarding possible bird hits .
