It would be put in the middle of the Bal Mandir,” Saraswati added. The proposed model of the Bal Mandir would be put on display at the camp of the Shankaracharya at Magh mela from Tuesday onwards.

Title: State gets 4 weeks’ time to file affidavit
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Kozhikode: The Supreme Court , on Monday, granted Kerala government four weeks ’ time to file an additional affidavit in the NH-766 night traffic ban case.

The court granted the request of the counsel of the Kerala government who pointed out that a request had been filed seeking time to file an additional affidavit on the court’s earlier suggestion in August 2018 on upgrading the alternative roads (Kutta-Gonikkupa route) so that the forest stretch of the NH-766 cutting through Bandipur Tiger Reserve can be closed down.

Meanwhile, Nilgiris-Wayanad NH and Railway Action Committee, which has been spearheading the campaign to revoke the decade-old night traffic ban, said that it was unfortunate that the state government could not submit a proper affidavit before the apex court on such an important issue even after five months.

The affidavit submitted by the Kerala government in the Supreme Court in December had sparked off a controversy as the affidavit was submitted a day before the ministerial-level meeting was a held in Thiruvananthapuram to finalize the points to be included in the affidavit.

Also, action committee leaders had pointed out that many points in the affidavit were not factual and could help the proposal for making the alternative road permanent. Following the row, the transport department authorities had said that they would file an additional affidavit.

It was the Karnataka high court which had imposed the night traffic ban on the forest stretch of NH- 766 linking Kerala and Karnataka in 2009 to prevent road-kills of wildlife and the Supreme Court made the suggestion on having an alternative road while considering Kerala government’s petition challenging the Karnataka high court order.

Title: Ajmer’s Patel Stadium all set to be renovated
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Ajmer: The oldest and one of the most important stadiums, Patel Stadium, will be renovated and modernised at a cost of Rs 43.17 crore. It will also have a swimming pool and a multi-storey building. The new stadium will also have a digital library.

District-level sports and competitions are held at Patel Stadium. Currently it has facilities for badminton and table tennis. Now, looking at the increasing number of players in the district, the Smart City project has taken the initiative to modernise the stadium.

It will take one year for the complete renovation of the stadium. The stadium will also have a swimming pool, basketball and volleyball courts. The stadium is situated in the heart of the city and is easily accessible from every direction.

Title: Man booked for extortion bid on industrialist
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: City police have booked a youth for allegedly demanding extortion of Rs 1 lakh from a city-based industrialist by threatening to make the personal photographs of the latter’s wife go viral on the internet.

Investigation officer and assistant sub-inspector Kalyan Shelke said, “We have registered a case against the suspect for trying to extort money from the woman teacher’s husband.”

Shelke said the process of identifying the suspect and as to how he got the contact number of the industrialist and his friend is also being probed.

As per complaint lodged by 52-year-old proprietor of a private limited firm, he received a call on Thursday afternoon from an unidentified number when he along with his wife and friend were sitting in their house, located on Beed Bypass road.

The suspect, while introducing him by his first name, told the industrialist that his wife has taken Rs 1 lakh from him and has stopped answering his phone calls. He even threatened that if his money is not paid, he will make the woman’s pictures go viral.

When the complainant inquired about it with his wife the latter claimed she had no idea about the suspect or the money. Later, the suspect called on the mobile phone of the industrialist’s friend who too was sitting in the house and reiterated his demand for money.

Initially the family, fearing social stigma, did not lodge a complaint. But on Sunday, they reached out to the Osmanpura police station and lodged a complaint against the suspect.

Title: Brave acts: 18-year-old who saved parents from Pakistan shelling, a cliffhanger and more
Content:
11-year-old Carolyn, who belongs to Mizoram, managed to rescue a girl from her abductor.

NEW DELHI: Alongside a 16-year-old braveheart who gave his life saving three friends , 21 other children were recognised for their acts of uncommon bravery by the Indian Council for Child Welfare (ICCW). Their names were announced on Tuesday at a media interaction with the children and their parents.However, there was no clarity on Tuesday about when the bravery awards would be given to the children and by whom. Last year, ICCW had found itself in an unnecessary controversy after the central government disassociated itself from these national awards. It is also unclear whether the 22 children will participate in the Republic Day parade as customary.While Muhammad Muhsin of Kozhikode, Kerala, lost his life saving three flailing friends in a turbulent sea, there were others who risked life and limb to save people. When TOI spoke to the parents of the 10 girls among the awardees, they were overcome by emotion at what their daughters had accomplished.Among the girls is Alaika, a 13-year-old from Himachal Pradesh. She saved her parents and grandfather as the car they were in hung in the air after falling down a cliff. Her mother, Savita Upadhyay, narrated, “We were driving to her cousin’s birthday. At Palampur our car went off the road, but luckily the car was stopped in its descent by a tree trunk. Alaika was the first to gain consciousness among us and she fearlessly scrambled up the cliff in the dark and got help. Had it not been for her, we wouldn’t have survived.” Long taunted in the village for not having a son, the family is now regarded with respect, she added.Adithya K’s moment also came during a car accident. On May 1 last year, the 15-year-old was returning from Nepal with 42 other tourists from Kerala when around 50km from the Indian border at Dunnein, the bus caught fire. The driver fled, leaving the passengers, among them five children and some senior citizens, stranded behind jammed doors. Adithya shattered the rear windshield with a hammer and kicked the glass out, ignoring the splinters that pierced his feet and arms. The passengers scrambled to safety, just in time to escape the diesel tank explosion.Sartaj Mohidin Mugal and Mudasir Ashraf from Jammu and Kashmir will be also honoured. Mugal was at home on October 24 when Pakistan violated the ceasefire and rained gunfire on Chowkibal and Tumina in Kashmir’s Kupwara district. A resident of Tumina village, he was on the first floor when a shell hit his house. He jumped out but realised that his two sisters and parents were still inside the house. He rushed back and brought his sisters out to safety. He then ran into the house and dragged his unconscious parents out before the house collapsed.Ashraf, 18, was one of the many villagers who rushed to the site of a MI-17 helicopter crash in his village of Grind Kalan in Budgam on February 27 last year. The teenager saw a man still alive in the burning chopper and risked his life trying to pull him out. Unfortunately, the man, engulfed in flames, could not be saved before help arrived. Later, when the rescue teams consisting of personnel of security forces and the National Disaster Relief Force reached the crash site, Ashraf assisted them in retrieving the mortal remains of the helicopter crew.

Title: ZSI conducts workshop on conservation of threatened Himalayan fauna
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Uttarkashi: A two-day workshop on conservation of threatened fauna in the Himalayan region through long-term monitoring and capacity building commenced at Van Chetana Kendra of Purola area in Uttarkashi on Monday.

Experts spread awareness among forest staff and local villagers on wildlife conservation, illegal trade and human-wildlife conflict mitigation during the workshop that was organised by Zoological Survey of India ( ZSI ), Kolkata, in association with Uttarakhand forest department.

On the first day of the workshop, speaker Vivek Joshi gave detailed information about wildlife monitoring and habitat modelling using advanced techniques. He also informed about the current status and threats to the key species found in Uttarkashi region.

Another speaker, Ashutosh Singh elaborated about wildlife crime and use of various techniques such as forensics, morphology and DNA for conservation of wildlife.

Yet another speaker Bheem Dutt Joshi spoke about steps being taken by ZSI for conservation of wildlife. “The aim of the project funded by National Mission of Himalayan Studies (NHMS) is to generate information on threatened Himalayan fauna, develop protocol for conservation of these species and to enhance capacity of forest department, NGOs, Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP), Border Roads Organisation (BRO) and local villagers. At present we are focusing on snow leopard, brown bear, Tibetan wolf, Himalayan thar, monal and some other prime species of Uttarkashi. We will plan our conservation activities and research on basis of these selected species.”

He added that studies have shown that increasing human intervention, climate change and other factors have adversely affected food and habitat of wild animals. “Therefore, it is important for forest staff to spread awareness and to keep vigil on illegal activities in forest areas as these would help in conservation,” he said.

Title: Ram temple should be like our model: VHP
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Allahabad: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad ( VHP ) said on Monday that a grand Ram temple should come up in Ayodhya just like the model designed by it and seers are waiting for Union government to set up a trust as per the Supreme Court order for pressing the demand.

Speaking at the meeting of Kendriya Margdarshak Mandal held at its camp at Parade ground on Monday, VHP general secretary Milind Parande said saints and seers are waiting for government to set up a trust for temple construction.

Paranade said VHP wants that the responsibility for construction be given to Ram Janmabhoomi Nyas.

The move was supported by Mahamandaleshwar Swami Akhileshwaranand Ji Maharaj and other saints attending the meeting. Parande said the seers hailed the Supreme Court decision paving the way for Ram temple and termed it a victory of ‘historic fact and values.’

Title: Blast at Moolamattom power plant
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Idukki: A major blast occurred at Moolamattom power plant of Idukki Hydroelectric project on Monday around 9.30pm. Officials haven’t revealed any reason for the blast that happened in the exciter transformer of the second generator after which smoke filled the underground power station. Power generation was stopped and all officials were evacuated. There were no causalities. Two officials, who complained of uneasiness and breathing troubles, were admitted to a hospital.

In 2011, a major blast occurred at the plant and two women officials, Merin Isaac (26) and KS Prabha (50) were killed. The underground power station was commissioned in 1976 and three generators were installed in the first phase and three more in second phase. The powerhouse has a total production capacity of 780MW.

Title: Air India starts direct flight to Surat from Bhubaneswar
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: The Air India on Monday started a direct flight from the Bhubaneswar airport to the Gujarat textile hub, Surat.

The flight, which will operate twice a week from both the places, took off from here with 81 passengers at 8.40am. Bhubaneswar MP Aparajita Sarangi travelled in the maiden flight to Surat.

The civil aviation ministry had on December 30 said Air India would be introducing the flight. “It was a long-standing demand of the people of Odisha . I am extremely happy that we finally have a direct flight to Surat,” she said.

The flyers were visibly upbeat about the direct flight to Surat. “It would take me more than 24 hours in a train to reach Surat. Now one can reach there within two hours.”

The Air India flight will fly to Surat on Monday and Thursday. The return flight will be available on Friday and Sunday. It’s departure time for both Bhubaneswar and Surat is 8.40am. Lakhs of Odia workers are working in the textile and construction sector in Surat.

Union petroleum minister Dharmendra Pradhan tweetted, “Happy to see this become a reality. Direct flight between Surat and Bhubaneswar will greatly ease travel for millions of Odias pursuing their business calling in the diamond city. Odisha samaj had advocated this issue during my visit to Odisha Parba in Surat”.

Title: Three arrested for robbing, killing sales executive in Rohini
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: Delhi Police has arrested three persons for robbing and killing the sales manager of a paint company near his residence in Rohini . The accused men had in a similar manner also killed another man after robbing his wallet.

TOI had on Saturday reported about the murder of the sales manager, Anil Kumar Duhan, who was found dead with a gunshot wound near his house on January 6. Duhan’s family members had also made a Facebook page asking help from people to identify the killers after police failed to get a breakthrough in the initial week.

“The accused have been identified as Ganga Ram, Rakesh and Raj Kishan. A countrymade pistol, live cartridge and an empty cartridge were seized. During investigation, police were informed about a similar incident using the same modus operandi reported from Begumpur,” said Gaurav Sharma, DCP (outer-north).

On January 6, Duhan was found lying near Baghban Apartments in Rohini, bleeding form his head. He was taken to a hospital where he was declared brought dead.

During the course of investigation, five teams were constituted to gather information about the accused. Police were informed about another murder using the same modus operandi in Begumpur just two days before Duhan’s murder. Aashu, a 19-year old, was found dead with a gunshot wound and his mobile was stolen.

Both the crime spots were found to be within the range of a kilometre. “In both the cases, mobile phones of the deceased were robbed and both were shot in the head,” added Sharma.

Title: VBA takes out rally in Beed, 3-day stir planned in Latur
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: The protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) continued in different parts of the region on Monday.

Activists of the Prakash Ambedkar-led Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi (VBA) took out a rally in Beed on Monday, while activists in Latur have planned a three-day stir in the city from January 22. Meanwhile, the sit-in agitations outside the district collector’s office in Aurangabad and Nanded continued.

After the rally, VBA activists in Beed handed over a memorandum to the district collector that sought the scrapping of the controversial laws. The agitators described these processes to be anti-people and against the constitution. VBA spokesperson Babanrao Wadmare said the President must intervene and reject these laws.

‘Amhi Laturkar, CAA, NRC Virodhi Jan Andolan’, an organization formed in Latur, has decided to stage agitations for three days at the Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Park to register their protest against the laws. Lawyer Uday Gaware said these laws were inter-connected and intended for all communities.

“These are not limited to Muslims, but the government intends to hit Hindus too, particularly adivasi, OBC, Buddhists, and other communities. It’s also intended to create differences among different communities and religions. In such a situation, people must join hands and resist the government’s divisive move,” he said.

He said intellectuals and social activists from across the country are expected to come to Latur to express their solidarity with the agitators. They are expecting visit by Justice B G Kolse Patil (retd), Swami Agnivesh, Waman Meshram, Kannan Gopinathan and noted poet Imran Pratapgadi , said Gaware.

Title: Seven, including four with crimerecords, killed in Churu mishap
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

The mangled remains of the SUV in which seven persons were killed

JAIPUR: Seven persons, most of whom from the same village, died in an accident in Salasar area of Churu district close to Sunday midnight.

The accident occurred when the SUV in which they were travelling rammed into a truck. The accident was so severe that all passengers except one died on the spot. The survivor was rushed to a nearby hospital, where he is undergoing treatment.

Five of them belonged to Rolsahabsar village in Churu district, while two others hailed from Sikar district . Police found that among those who died, four had criminal records. They also found weapons from the mangled SUV. “We found one pistol, four cartridges and four iron rods from the SUV. Four of them had criminal records,” police superintendent of police Tejaswani Gautam told TOI.

The deceased have been identified as Imran Khan, Gazi Khan, Imran, Rafiq, Iqbal Khan, Babu Khan and Islam. Police received information about the accident around 11.45pm.

According to police, the SUV collided with a trolley or truck which has not been identified. “We are collecting footage from toll plazas to identify the vehicle which was involved in the accident,” said Gautam.

However, the police are hopeful of getting vital clues from the survivor, identified as Iqbal. Once he is able to speak, police will record his statement and collect more facts about the accident.

Police have registered a case against an unidentified vehicle based on a complaint filed by a relative of a person killed in the accident.

Title: CM Yogi Adityanath’s visit on January 22 to dispel misgivings about CAA, NRC
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

CM Yogi Adityanath

KANPUR: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath is likely to address a gathering at the Commercial park in Kidwainagar on January 22 to counter the narrative of opposition parties about the Citizenship Amendment Act and NRC . The CM will be accompanied by state minister Narendra Singh.

BJP’s regional president Manvendra Singh said, “The CM is likely to address a gathering at Commercial park in Kidwainagar on January 22 and preparations are underway for the programme.”

Singh said the CM will tell the people that “CAA is to give citizenship to the persecuted minorities of the neighbouring countries Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan and not to take away anyone’s citizenship, as the opposition is making out.”

He added, “The Act is not against any Indian citizen, but is against those who entered the Indian territory illegally and are involved in anti-social and anti-national activities.”

As per instructions, BJP workers are going for a door-to-door campaign and informing the citizens about the facts regarding the amended Act. Police and administrative officials had on Sunday inspected the Commercial park.

A team, headed by IG Mohit Agarwal, district magistrate Dr Brahma Deo Ram Tiwari, SSP Anant Deo, municipal commissioner Akshay Tripathi and ADM (City) Vivek Tripathi inspected the proposed site.

Title: Farmer jumps before train in Ghatampur
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

KANPUR: A farmer in Patara area of Ghatampur committed suicide by jumping in front of a speeding train on Kanpur-Banda section on Monday.

The deceased was identified as Mewa Lal (58) of Kushara village in neighbouring Fatehpur district .

According to his family members Mewa Lal was suffering from some mental imbalance, said the police.

“He left home on Monday morning saying that he was going to his in-laws but instead reached nearby railway under-pass on Kanpur-Banda section and jumped in front of a moving train,” said Patara Police out-post incharge Hari Shambhu Singh . A probe has been ordered in the case.

Family dispute could be the reason behind Mewa Lal’s extreme step, said an official.

Title: Man shot at by two over land dispute in Vallabh Vidyanagar
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA/ ANAND: A middle-aged man suffered severe injuries after private firing near a dining hall on Janta crossroads on the outskirts of education town Vallabh Vidyanagar in Anand district .

The victim identified as Hari Dhula Bharwad suffered injuries after two accused opened fire on Monday evening.

According to police sources, Bharwad was sitting with his group of friends outside the dining hall when two accused got off from a white coloured compact SUV.

There were four persons inside the car of which two accused identified as Mehul Rabari and Govind Rabari got off the vehicle.

At first, Govind opened fire in the air. Later, the accused fire another round from the revolver towards the group. While others in the group escaped unhurt, a bullet hit Bharwad on his waist.

Bharwad was shifted to Karamsad-based Shree Krishna Hospital where he was being treated by a team of doctors at the trauma and emergency care centre while a huge group of relatives and friends had thronged the hospital premises.

After the incident, Vallabh Vidyanagar police reached the spot, while an FSL team also rushed to the spot of the incident.

Cops were checking CCTV footage of the incident to get more details of the crime even as Vallabh Vidyanagar police was in the process of registering a complaint. Sources said that Bharwad was attacked by the accused over an old dispute over a land dispute in Valetva village of Anand district.

Title: 4 die after pvt bus rams govt vehicle in Kallakurichi
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Villupuram: Four people died and 20 others were injured when a speeding private bus crashed into a stationary government bus and ploughed into a group of people standing on the roadside at Eranji in Kallakurichi district in the early hours of Monday.

The accident happened when the occupants of a car were arguing with a Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) bus driver whose alleged ‘negligence’ had caused a minor accident a few minutes earlier. The deceased included Rajan Vinnarasu, 29, of Arakkonam and an occupant of the car, and three bus passengers, including Vellaisamy, 39, of Ayangudi, and Sargunam, 34, of Kalathur in Kancheepuram district. The identity of the other deceased was not known, police said.

The accident happened when V S Issac Aiyya of Arakkonam, who runs several educational institutes and is the founder of Akila India Jananayaka Makkal Katchi (Dr Issac), and his family were returning from Tirunelveli following the betrothal of his son Vinnarasu. Around 3.30am, when they reached Eranji on Trichy-Chennai national highway, a TNSTC bus hit their car. Vinnarasu and others got down from the vehicle and entered into an argument with the bus driver, blaming him for the accident. The bus passengers got down and tried to pacify them. As the argument continued, the private bus rammed the stationary bus and hit the crowd, killing four people. Three of the injured were critical, police said.

On being informed by some road users, the Ulundurpet police rushed to the spot and sent the injured to a hospital. Following the accident, traffic on the busy Trichy-Chennai national highway was affected for more than two hours.

Title: 82 per cent of students cleared hostel dues, claims JNU VC M Jagadesh Kumar
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

M Jagadesh Kumar

NEW DELHI: JNU vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar in a statement on Monday claimed that out of the 8,500 students at the varsity, 82% of them had cleared their hostel dues for the winter registration. He added that the remaining students were also expected to complete their registration process, and the campus was peaceful despite the strike call given by the students’ union.

The VC announced that for their Republic Day parade, NCC cadets of the varsity will be participating. “The university is putting every effort to help the willing students in getting registered for the winter semester . The campus is peaceful and active in pursuing academic activities,” he stated.

The VC’s claims were contradicted by JNUSU, which said that the strike and boycott of academic activities were still going on in the campus. “How can classes happen when the backlog of monsoon semester is not yet cleared?” asked Saket Moon, JNUSU vice-president.

Since the inter-hall administration (IHA) meeting on October 28, which hiked the hostel fee, protests have continued on the varsity premises. Recently, there was a call to boycott registrations for the winter semester. But as per claims of the VC, 82% of the students have cleared their hostel dues for the winter registration.

“Only clearing hostel dues, however, doesn’t mean that students have registered. You have to pay advance hostel and mess charges and also the registration charges. That is yet to happen for a majority of students,” said Farhat Salim, councillor of the centre for the study of law and governance.

Moon claimed that the students are still with JNUSU and waiting for the legal action. “The union will file a case on January 21 against the IHA meeting, terming it a violation of the JNU constitution.”

The VC said in his statement that the university was also gearing up to celebrate the Republic Day.

“This year, for the first time, the NCC cadets of the university will be participating in a parade at the venue of flag hoisting during the Republic Day celebrations,” Kumar added.

Title: Slum dwellers relocated from airport land to make way for longer taxiway
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

The BMC has moved the families to Panda Kudia, a locality where they will get a piece of land under Rajiv Awas... Read More

BHUBANESWAR: Work on the expansion of the parallel taxiway at Biju Patnaik International Airport is likely to start soon, as the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) has addressed the biggest hurdle facing the upgrade — encroachment of land.

The BMC on Monday relocated 110 families from the Farm Gate slum, which had come up on the land needed for the expansion of the parallel taxiway. The BMC has moved the families to Panda Kudia, a locality where they will get a piece of land under Rajiv Awas Yojana.

“The relocation began in the morning. The Panda Kudia locality has been identified for the slum residents’ relocation. There were a few encroachers on that land as well, but we have freed the area of them,” said a BMC officer.

The airport had sought land for the expansion of the taxiway in 2015. The BMC officials said they had received Rs 2 crore from the Airports Authority of India to rehabilitate the residents of the slum. The relocation took four years, even though the residents had given their consent to the process.

The airport requires close to an acre of land to expand the parallel taxiway. Currently, it has a short taxiway, which is used by aircraft to access the runway. The disadvantage of the short taxiway is that aircraft have to make a U-turn to take off after getting on to the runway. A parallel taxiway — which is the path between the runway and the apron — will allow the aircraft to run parallel with the runway and get on to it only when it is ready to take off. The present taxiway category of the airport is 4C; after the expansion it will be 4D.

The parallel taxiway will thus reduce the waiting time for departing flights as they will no longer need to make turns on the runway. “The Air Traffic Control can declare the runway space free more quickly after the parallel taxiway becomes operational,” an airport official said.

The city airport records around 63,000 aircraft movements a year.

Title: RSS volunteers to distribute pro-CAA pamphlets in city
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

The two-page pamphlet

Allahabad: The protests erupting across the country against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) aside, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh ( RSS ) has roped in over 30,000 volunteers to distribute pamphlets containing detailed about the law to muster support.

The volunteers are associated with various organisations associated closely with RSS, namely Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP), BJP’s Yuva Morcha (BJPYM), LokJagran Manch (LJM), Akhil Bhartiya Vidyarathi Parishad (ABVP), Bajrang Dal and Durga Vahini.

“RSS has divided the entire district into two parts, Prayag Uttar (city north) and Prayag Dakshin (city south). Then there are 29 nagar (wards) spanning across different localities,” said RSS prantiya prachaar pramukh, Murarji Tripathi.

The two-page pamphlet features photographs of minor Hindu girls who were abducted or sexually abused and were forced to convert to Islam in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. Besides, the pamphlet also mentions several facts about the new citizenship law under a column called ‘myth’.

The document also features a picture of Mahatma Gandhi and one of his quotes which reads: “Pakistan me rehne wale Hindu aur Sikh har nazariya se Bharat aa sakte hai, agar wo wahan nahi rehna chahte hain. Tab unhe naukri dena, unke jeevan ko samanya banana Bharta sarkar ka pehla kartavya hai. (Hindus and Sikh living in Pakistan can always come to India, if they do not want to live there. In such a situation, it is the government’s responsibility to provide them with jobs and ensure that there is normalcy in their lives.)”

The coloured pamphlet explains why the government introduced CAA in the country.

Title: Family of deceased 19-yr-old woman lodges plaint
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Tirupati: An air of mystery shrouds the death of a 19-year-old housewife, reported at Dandi Kuppam village in Santhipuram mandal of Chittoor district.

According to Rallabaduguru police, the parents and relatives of the victim—Soundarya—lodged a complaint against her husband and family members, stating they were involved in her death, which they suspected as unnatural.

Soundarya, who hails from Bangarupet in Karnataka, got married to Vinod Kumar of Dandi Kuppam village about two years ago. Soundarya’s parents said that they gave Vinod Kumar dowry along with several precious gifts at the time of the marriage.

In their complaint, Soundarya’s parents alleged that the couple had been leading a disturbed life on account of multiple altercations between them in the last six months.

On Sunday night, after Soundarya was found lying unconscious at her home at Dandi Kuppam village, her husband and in-laws rushed her to PES hospital at Kuppam, where she died while undergoing treatment.

Suspecting her daughter’s death was not natural, the victim’s mother along with other family members lodged a complaint at the Rallabuduguru police station on Monday.

Sub inspector Murali Mohan said a case was registered and further investigation was going on. He clarified that the cause of death remained unclear and police were awaiting the autopsy report to proceed.

Title: After twin failures, Ravenshaw University starts recruiting teachers
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

CUTTACK: Ravenshaw University has finally started recruitment of teachers and has invited applications for 180 posts of professors, associate professors and assistant professors. This is significant as the university has been facing acute faculty crunch and working with only around 100 teachers for over six years.

The university started accepting online applications from January 10. The last date to send in applications is February 10.

Vice-chancellor Ishan Patro told TOI on Monday that the university hoped to complete the process in three to five months. “The recruitment process will be time-consuming. Applications have been invited for 180 posts in 19 departments,” he said. “Scrutiny of applications and scheduling of dates for interviews will depend on the number of applications received,” the vice-chancellor added.

University officials said more than 2,500 applications were expected for 24 professors’ posts, 44 associate professors’ posts and 115 assistant professors’ posts.

Since 2014, Ravenshaw initiated the recruitment process twice but failed to make any appointment as the high court had quashed both advertisements on grounds that they violated University Grants Commission (UGC) guidelines.

The Ravenshaw Bikash Abhijan (RBA), which constitutes city-based alumna and social activists, hoped that the university would complete the recruitment process this time. “We are happy that Ravenshaw has finally started the process for recruitment of teachers. We expect the authorities to ensure that the advertisement is litigation-proof,” RBA president Chittaranjan Mohanty said.

Title: Maharashtra’s first skills lab for doctors at GMCH soon
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Budding doctors in Government Medical College and Hospital ( GMCH ) will soon get opportunity to practise their clinical and surgical skills on virtual patients identical to humans.

The department of medical education and drugs has given administrative approval of Rs3.63 crore to the GMCH for purchase of orthopaedic and gynaecology simulators on turnkey basis. This means the supplier of equipment will design, manufacture, install and commission the equipment, will conduct tests, trials, training and hand it over to the GMCH for operation.

GMCH dean Dr Sajal Mitra claimed it was a major boost to establish skills lab in the institution. “Following MCI nod, GMCH will establish skills lab soon. For this, we already have basic and middle level equipment. Proposals were pending for approval by the state government for advanced and highly advanced machines. Now, we have received administrative approval for two important simulators,” Dr Mitra said. The lab will be established at the top floor of medical stores building.

Skills lab will have mannequins for basic operations such as CPR, intramuscular injection, catheterization, suture procedure etc. In advanced category, doctors may try their hands in joint replacements such as shoulder, hip, knee joint and other operations. Dr Mitra said lab would be linked with international certification agencies in future.

“Skills lab will fulfil all global standards. So, we will link it with many national and international certificate courses. Students will get their skills tested on simulators and get certificates from global agencies right here,” Dr Mitra added.

At present, Lokmanya Tilak municipal general hospital and medical college (Sion Hospital) has some simulators and runs such courses. GMCH will be first state government medical college to have full-fledged skills lab and certificate courses. Procurement of simulators will be conducted through Hopkins Institute and the lab is expected to be established in the next four months.

Title: NCAS team inspects Kamlapati Memorial Hospital
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Kanpur: A two-member team of National Quality Assurance Standard ( NCAS ) inspected Kamlapati Memorial Hospital (KPM) on Monday to assess the facilities and behaviour of the staff. It will hand over its report to the government.

The two-member team, consisting of Dr Tella Rajpal and Dr Ravi Shankar of Andhra Pradesh reached the hospital on Monday morning and inspected the hospital building, pathology, facilities being provided to patients and behaviour of the staff with patients. The team first inspected the outdoor patient department (OPD).

The two doctors of the team checked the patients' ticket papers, met the doctors and thereafter minutely observed the hospital’s pharmacy, OPD, labour room, pathology, implementation of the National Health Scheme and the general administration. They also sought feedback from district quality advisor Dr Arif Beg and hospital superintendent Dr Jyoti Saxena and asked them about the facilities being provided by the hospital.

The team will inspect the records of the hospital on Tuesday. The District Quality Assurance Standard team consisting of Dr Khushboo Chaturvedi, KPM quality manager, Neha, quality manager of Kashiram Hospital Dr Surendra were present during the inspection.

Dr Surendra and Dr Priyanka told the team members that health centres were being certified to maintain the quality of the health services. In order to qualify, each department of the hospital must achieve 70 per cent marks and improve their working on eight points.

The eight points are services available in a hospital, rights of the patient, availability of ward and apparatus, maintenance of apparatus and machines, quality of treatment to patients, infection control, quality management and assessment of monthly achievements.

Title: PM Narendra Modi must clear the air on NRC: Najeeb Jung at Jamia Millia Islamia
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Najeeb Jung

NEW DELHI: Ex-lieutenant governor of Delhi and former vice-chancellor of Jamia Millia Islamia, Najeeb Jung , on Monday expressed solidarity with the varsity students, who have been protesting against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), National Register of Citizens (NRC) and the alleged police action in the campus on December 15.

Addressing the students near the varsity campus, Jung said that the agitation will continue till demands of equality before law are met. The new citizenship act needs a revamp and should include Muslims as well, he added. He requested the Prime Minister and the home minister to hold a press conference and clear the air on NRC.

“The PM has said that NRC will not happen but why do people not believe it? This is a matter of shame that lakhs don’t believe in the PM as there are detention centres being built in Assam and other places. I suggest the PM and the home minister to hold a press conference and state that there won’t be any NRC.”

Jung further told the students: “Nobody can ask you if you are an Indian or not. The agitation won’t end till amendment is made to the CAA. And amendment is not difficult as they just have to include the religion that has been excluded.”

“Granting citizenship on the basis of religion violates Article 14 of the Constitution.”

The former LG added that at the time of Anna Hazare’s anti-corruption andolan, Arvind Kejriwal and others were called by the government to discuss the issues. “Today when the entire country is revolting why the government doesn’t want to meet them? The government should clarify and satisfy the students as today’s youth will run the country in future,” he said.

Calling NRC as the ‘dada’ of CAA, he said that the movement against CAA should remain secular. “This is not just a Muslim protest, but an Indian protest.”

Despite efforts to divide the country, the Act has united people for communal harmony, he added.

He asked students to remember Mahatma Gandhi and Maulana Mohamamd Ali Johar. “This agitation should be led by students and has no place for clerics and their ideas."

Title: Lover rapes woman in Kanpur hotel, absconding
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

Title: Housing board seeks VMC help to get dilapidated houses vacated
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Safety is major concern now for buildings constructed 30 years ago

Vadodara: Concerned over stability of its houses constructed three decades ago, Gujarat Housing Board (GHB) has approached Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) asking it to issue notices to occupants and get the houses vacated.

The GHB has a series of schemes across the city, particularly in western parts like Gorwa and Subhanpura. Many of these houses were constructed 30 years ago and have become a reason for concern for the housing board now.

The GHB has written to the VMC stating that the board has no authority to get these houses vacated. It has stated that notices had been issued to the blocks earlier and a public notice too was issued in this regard. Despite this, the residents have not vacated the houses.

Sources said the offers of redevelopment of such colonies by the housing board have also met with lukewarm response. Fearing for the safety of the houses as well as those staying there, the GHB has started the process of conducting a structural audit of the buildings. Parallel to the process, the board wrote a letter to the VMC asking it to issue notices to the residents and get the houses vacated. The board has contended that it has no authority to get the houses vacated.

VMC sources said the issue was discussed in detail and the civic body had decided to ask the board for structural report of the houses. The VMC will take further action based on the structural report. An official said issuing notices in bulk would lead to a lot of panic.

“There are hundreds of such houses and any action without strong grounds can lead to panic. Once the report is finalized, we can take action based on it,” said the official. He said the VMC would reply to the GHB accordingly.

Title: MLC poll: MVA, BJP candidates take pole position
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Yavatmal: Dushiyant Chaturvedi of Shiv Sena, who is official candidate of Maha Vikas Aghadi, and Sumit Bajoria of BJP are racing ahead of the four other candidates in the fray for by-election to the state legislative council ( MLC ) poll from Yavatmal . The electorate are members of local self government bodies.

The remaining candidates, Shankar Bade, Sanjay Derkar, Shrikant Munginwar and Deepak Neelawar, are all contesting as independents. The polling will be held on January 31.

Munginwar and Bade are Congress rebels. BJP took Bajoria, an NCP activist, in its fold at the last minute and granted ticket to him though many BJP loyalists had sought candidature.

Both Dushiyant and Sumit are financially sound and their supporters have already started contacting the 490 voters who are members of zilla parishad, municipal councils and nagar panchayats.

It is learnt, prominent candidates are trying to move voters to an unknown destination to secure their votes. But voters are not swearing allegiance to any particular camp as the voting date is still 10 days away.

In 2016, the Shiv Sena-BJP alliance candidate Tanaji Sawant had won the poll though Congress had the upper edge. Both Dushyant and Sumit consider it as a prestigious election for their political career.

Title: Revenue official caught taking bribe of Rs 3 lakh in Krishna district
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: The anti-corruption bureau ( ACB ) caught a revenue official red-handed while she was demanding and accepting bribe at the district collectorate in Machilipatnam in Krishna district on Monday.

The accused, identified as Prashanthi, is an officer in the land reforms section. According to ACB officials, they received a complaint from Meka Ramalingeswara Reddy of Undavalli village in Guntur district.

In his complaint, he stated that he had purchased around 4.53 acres of land in Katuru village in Krishna district in 2015 in his mother’s and sister’s names. They had then applied for pattadar passbooks at the tahsildar’s office at Vuyyur town through Mee Seva. The tahsildar told them that as the land is under Land Ceiling Act the file will be processed in the land reforms’ section at the district collectorate in Machilipatnam. On January 10, the tahsildar of Vuyyur sent notices to him and his mother and sister to meet the section officer in land reforms to get the pattadar passbooks and title deeds for their land.

When they met Prasanthi on January 12, she demanded Rs 6 lakh to issue the pattadar passbooks. Later, on January 19, she demanded that they part her Rs 3 lakh first. Following this, Ramalingeswara Reddy lodged a complaint with the ACB who laid a trap on Monday afternoon. The bribe money was recovered from Prasanthi and both her hands tested positive during the chemical test.

They also registered a case and placed her under arrest. She will be produced before the Vijayawada ACB court for judicial remand.

Title: Delhi: RTI casts doubt on claims of damage to JNU server room
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Jawaharlal Nehru University

NEW DELHI: A Right to Information query filed by an activist has put a question mark on the claims made by the JNU administration regarding the damage to the server room on January 3 and 4.

The reply to the RTI filed under the “life and liberty” clause by activist Saurav Das mentioned that 17 optical fibres were damaged on January 4 at 1pm, but, contrary to the JNU administration’s claims, it stated that the server room was shut on January 3.

“There is no mention of any damage on January 3, the day on which the administration claims that masked vandals entered and destroyed the servers, thereby stopping the registration process,” Das said. The RTI mentions that “register entries could not be done due to the crisis situation for resuming ICT services” and “the premises was under full control of security branch”.

The RTI also revealed that the university didn’t have any continuous footage of the four CCTV cameras at the north gate of the varsity on January 5, the day outsiders entered the campus and unleashed violence on students.

On the query put up by Das as to why there was no recording of the day the violence took place, the administration clarified that CCTV cameras were Wi-Fi enabled and, hence, no recording was done. The administration also informed that no footage of the CCTV cameras were uploaded to the cloud computing platform.

The FIR registered by Delhi Police on the complaint of the JNU administration had said that the servers were damaged, hence there was no CCTV footage.

Despite several attempts made by TOI, the JNU administration did not respond to queries.

Title: Vijayawada station sets up solar panels on cover over platform
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Solar panels on the roof of Vijayawada station

VIJAYAWADA: Vijayawada railway station has become the first in the country to set up a solar photovoltaic cover over platform (COP) at platform numbers 4 and 5 in the station.

A press release said the plan to utilise the platform roof to harness solar energy is the first-of-its-kind in the history of Indian Railways. The capacity of the solar plant installed at Vijayawada station is 65 kilowattpeak (kWp), the highest installed on any cover over platform in a railway station.

The station is also the first to have an installed capacity of over 50 kWp solar panels on a cover over platform.

The solar roof has been installed at a cost of Rs 60 lakhs. Given the hot and humid climate of Vijayawada, railway officials are exploring means to harness solar power to cater to the electricity consumption needs of the station. The cover over platform on platform numbers 4 and 5 has been made up of solar panels without using any galvanized sheets.

To install the solar plant, 198 solar panels, each with a capacity of 330 Wp were erected directly onto the shelter, covering a length of 33 meters. Power generated from the structure can cover 17 per cent of the power needs of the station, resulting in a savings of Rs 8.1 lakhs per annum.

Apart from power generation, the solar panels provide shelter to passengers. Plans are underway to set up a similar solar COP.

Gajanan Mallya, general manager of South Central Railway (SCR) zone appreciated the efforts of Vijayawada division officials. He advised officials to set up more such plants. “These solar plants will help in reducing the expenditure of the zone towards power needs and also helps in promoting a green environment,” he said.

Title: 11-year-old raped by 55-year-old neighbour
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: An 11-year-old girl was raped by a 55-year-old man at his residence in Mangalagiri town of Guntur district on Sunday. Though the crime happened at around 2.30 pm on Sunday, it came to light on Monday after the girl informed confided to her parents who immediately informed the police.

The accused, a daily wage labourer who stays near the victim’s house, was first thrashed by the girl’s parents and neighbours before being handed over to the police. Police said the incident happened in the afternoon when the victim was playing outside the accused’s house with another girl. Noticing that her parents were not in the house, the accused allegedly sent the other girl to a local grocery store to buy chocolates and took the little girl to his home where he forced himself on her.

After her parents returned, the girl told them what had happened. Cops have registered a case under relevant sections of Pocso Act and section 376 of IPC against the accused.

Title: Activists oppose govt’s decision on DPR for Vishwamitri river
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Activists urge government first to implement orders of Supreme Court and the NGT before preparing DPR for the ... Read More

Vadodara: Environment activists have opposed Gujarat government’s decision to prepare a detail project report (DPR) for Vishwamitri river.

City-based Paryavaran Suraksha Samiti (PSS) on Monday issued notices to Gujarat chief minister (CM), chief secretary, heads of state and central pollution control boards apart from heads of municipal corporation and district administration to first implement the earlier orders of Supreme Court, the National Green Tribunal and other bodies before preparing DPR for the river that passes through the heart of the city.

“Gujarat CM organised an urgent meeting on December 20 and made an announcement about DPR for the river. We are utterly shocked as it did not put any direction for resolving the pending issues regarding the river and neither it addressed failure of Vadodara Municipal Corporation in implementing repeated directions given by the concerned authorities,” environment activist Rohit Prajapati said.

The activists have demanded that there should be investigation on why earlier directives from various bodies were not followed and all officials responsible for the inaction should be prosecuted.

Also, they have demanded that construction and demolition waste management rules should be implemented, technically correct contour survey, digital elevation models should be prepared with the advise from experts.

PSS has demanded that there should be a semi-statutory body comprising of subject experts as well as experienced members of the community at large to guide and monitor the remediation of the damage done and any new development initiatives that the government would undertake to improve local ecosystems.

Also, disaster mitigation plans for the city by using landscape and ecosystem approaches right from the origin of Vishwamitri river and all the villages and towns in the watershed of this river should be prepared.

Title: NDRF mock drill in February for BIMSTEC countries
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Odisha had won global acclaim for tackling of Cyclone Fani that struck the Odisha coast near Puri on May 3 las... Read More

BHUBANESWAR: Odisha will host a mock drill of BIMSTEC countries — Bangladesh, India, Myanmar, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Nepal and Bhutan — on tackling disasters such as floods and cyclones from February 11 to 14.

Disclosing this here on Monday, National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) director general Satya Narayan Pradhan said, “The National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) chose Odisha for the mock drill because of its experience and excellence. This apart, the heritage sites of Puri and Konark along the coastline make it a perfect choice.” The mock drill would be part of the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation Disaster Management Exercise.

Odisha had won global acclaim for tackling of Cyclone Fani that struck the Odisha coast near Puri on May 3 last year, causing large-scale damage to infrastructure. It was the rarest of rare summer cyclones — the first one in 43 years to hit Odisha and one of the three to hit the state in last 150 years with a wind velocity of over 200 km/hour. Because of massive mobilisation of manpower, the government managed to keep the death toll at a low of 64.

Pradhan said the BIMSTEC event will be inaugurated in Bhubaneswar. After a theoretical session and indoors discussions on the first day, the professionals will shift to the artificial village near Ramachandi for the practice session, the NDRF DG said.

The NDRF DG said around 16 to 20 representatives from the participating countries will take part in the mock exercise. “An artificial village will be created near Ramachandi (on Puri-Konark Marine Drive). Simulation of the artificial village and a big temple being flooded will be done to learn the practise the rescue exercise,” he said.

While NDRF will be the nodal agency to execute the mock drill, other agencies (fire, state disaster response forces) involved in similar operations would also participate. All the participating nations have similar experience of floods and cyclone in the Bay of Bengal, he said.

Pradhan, who paid a courtesy call to chief minister Naveen Patnaik, said during a meeting with Naveen, the state government proposed to have NDRF points — stationing of manpower and facilities — at Nabarangpur and Burla ( Sambalpur ). A decision on this may be taken in a few weeks, he said.

Title: Health services will be strengthened, says Subhash Desai
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Subhash Desai (R)

AURANGABAD: Guardian minister Subhash Desai on Monday said health facilities in the district would soon be strengthened.

Desai, who also holds the industry portfolio, said inspection of facilities would be carried out immediately to ensure that all health centres, including Government Medical College and Hospital, get adequate stock of medicines.

Speaking during the district planning and development council (DPDC) meeting, Desai also reviewed use of funds for different projects. He said that schemes meant for services like education, health, transportation and financial assistance to the needy should be implemented on priority.

The minister warned of stern action against those neglecting proper implementation of the schemes. He urged the officials to coordinate with the people representatives to complete the projects and works within specified time limit.

During the meeting Gangapur MLA Prashant Bamb and Sena MLC Ambadas Danve pointed out the road from Bibi-ka-Maqbara to Aurangabad Caves has been not been completed within the specified time. Minister of state for revenue Abdul Sattar along with MLAs Sanjay Shirsath and Atul Save drew Desai’s attention towards non-shifting of electric poles standing in the middle of the road.

Aurangabad MP Imtiyaz Jaleel, MLAs Pradeep Jaiswal, Atul Save and MLC Ambadas Danve raised the issue of lack of medicine at the GMCH. They also pointed out that many machines at the hospital were out of order while hospital didn’t have enough stock of medicines.

Desai informed the members that he would speak with chief minister Uddhav Thackeray and the health minister to sort things out on priority.

Meawnhile, horticulture minister Sandipan Bhumre, MLAs Ramesh Bornare, Udaysinh Rajput, mayor Nandkumar Ghodele, ZP president Meena Shelke, collector Uday Chaudhary, municipal commissioner Astik Kumar Pandey and planning officer Vijay Pawar were also present.

Title: Congress will not let country be divided on religion: Wadettiwar
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Chandrapur: Chandrapur guardian minster Vijay Wadettiwar reached out afresh to the Muslim community, claiming that whatever be the judgment of Supreme Court over Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), Congress party will not let the country be divided on the grounds of religion. Congress leader Wadettiwar, along with MP Balu Dhanorkar and MLA Pratibha Dhanorkar led a protest march against CAA, NPR and NRC at the district collectorate on Monday afternoon.

Addressing a massive rally after the protest march, Wadettiwar claimed that thousands of people were denied benefits of various government schemes for not having requisite documents of residency, ancestry, place and date of birth. “People queued up for days for validation of caste and correction of names is a common sight. Still, the BJP government has passed a draconian law like CAA and is all set to bring NRC, only to harass the people and divert their attention from burning issues in country,” he said.

MP Dhanorkar and MLA Pratibha Dhanorkar too lashed out at the BJP government and assured the Muslims and other communities that no harm would come their way through NRC.

Independent MLA Kishor Jorgewar, who had garnered a massive victory during the assembly elections, came under fire by a Muslim cleric for his alleged apathy towards the distressed community for critical issues CAA and NRC in Chandrpaur. The speaker accused him of betraying the Muslim community on the issue and warned of consequences during the next election.

Over 5000 men and woman marched from Gandhi Chowk to District Collectorate to protest against CAA, NPR and NRC.

Title: As govt schools fail to provide info about routers, DIOS warns of action
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Meerut: As 105 government schools in the district have failed to provide details of routers set up on their premises for live monitoring of board examinations, district inspector of schools (DIOS) has warned that stringent action will be taken against them if the details are not provided immediately.

DIOS GK Chaudhary said, “All school principals were asked to provide details of the routers and DVR sets installed on the school premises to facilitate live monitoring from the control room during the board exams. However, they have not provided the information despite repeated reminders.” “All details should be made available with immediate effect failing which stringent action would be taken against the principal concerned. They will also be held responsible for any lapse during the board exams,” he added.

As many as 105 exam centres have been finalised for board exams in the district this year as against 107 the previous time. Also, 43,423 students have registered for the class X board examinations and 43,242 for class XII this year. The same was 43,783 for class X and 40,309 for class XII respectively in 2019.

Title: 2 sacked, 3 shifted for seeking bribe for house allotment
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Slug: PM Awaas Yojana

Bijnor: After complaints against officials for allegedly seeking a bribe for allotting houses under PM Awaas Yojana (urban) in Bijnor, District Urban Development Agency (DUDA) directed the private company assigned the task of identifying the beneficiaries to sack a junior engineer and surveyor and transfer three other employees.

On Monday, the company dismissed junior engineer Ravi Kashyap and surveyor Deep Singh, who were posted in Haldaur civic body. Another junior engineer, Ravindra Kumar, and surveyors Parveen Kumar and Sachin Kumar, were shunted to another area. They were posted in Jhalu Nagar panchayat

The action was taken after applicants for the scheme in their complaint alleged that these employees were asking for Rs 20,000 as bribe from each beneficiary for allotting houses to them.

The PM Awaas Yojana, urban, launched by the ministry of housing and urban poverty alleviation envisages housing for all by 2022. Under the scheme, people who do not have their own houses or live in ‘kuchha’ houses are eligible. They are provided around Rs 2.50 lakh in three installments for buying the houses built under the yojana. In Bijnor district, some 30,000 people have applied for 15,742 units to be built in the current financial year.

According to sources, DUDA had hired some surveyors and junior engineers from a private company to survey and verify the applicants. However, the two junior engineers and three surveyors who were assigned the task were found allegedly extorting money from would-be beneficiaries by promising them a house under the scheme.

Narendra Mishra, project officer of DUDA, said, “Applicants under the scheme complained that some junior engineers and surveyors were forcing them to give money for providing a house to each of them. After receiving the complaints, we probed the matter and asked the company to sack or transfer the erring employees.”

Some months ago, the issue was raised at a meeting headed by in charge minister and he had ordered re-verification of the beneficiaries. At that time, some opposition party MLAs had claimed that ineligible applicants were being selected under the scheme.

Title: Telangana: Adibatla, home to aero SEZ, thirsts for water
Content:
Even though there are many new apartments, there are many empty plots in the area

HYDERABAD: Even as several big companies are located in and around Adibatla municipal limits , the area is struggling for public amenities. Residents, especially employees working in Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) and Tata Boeing Aerospace Limited (TBAL), demand basic healthcare facilities, sufficient supply of drinking water and public transport network. Currently, residents have to travel at least 15km to reach a super speciality hospital.With both the Tata companies coming up in Adibatla locality, their employees mostly stay in apartments that come up in the last two to three years.While there are a lot of under-construction buildings, the locality doesn’t have even a single hospital. While small mechanic sheds, grocery stores and food stalls have surfaced in Adibatla, there are no medical stores and diagnostic centres here.“We have a general physician in our office. But in case of emergency, there is no clinic or super speciality hospital within 15km,” said D Pratik Dalal an engineer with TCS. An employee from TBAL agreed: “While educational institutions have come up in this area, medical facility is pathetic.”Ahead of the municipal polls, locals here are demanding safe drinking water. Naveen Patibandla, a local, said: “We are totally dependent on bore-well water. There are drinking water pipelines, but they are yet to be made operational. I request the authorities to ensure sufficient drinking water. We have to by drinking water.”Sridhar B, an employee of TCS, said: “There are hardly any buses or autos, and cabbies cancel rides when they learn the location is far away from the city. I only see one bus in the morning and evening.”

Title: Police bust gang involved in 9 cases of robbery, loot in Meerut, Muzaffarnagar
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

MEERUT: Four members of a Meerut-based gang were arrested in what is seen as police crackdown in the recent spike in cases of robbery and loot in the district and Muzaffarnagar .

A huge cache of gold and silver jewellery, cash, weapons and vehicles was recovered from the gang which had kept the district police in Meerut and Muzaffarnagar on it toes for the past two months. Kingpin of the gang, Chand alias Kale, a historysheeter from Parikshitgarh police station in Meerut, is still absconding.

According to senior police officers, the gang used to mainly target petrol pumps, banks, gas godowns, jewellery stores and cash transit agencies. After the gang was busted, police claim to have solved several cases of robbery and loot in Meerut and Muzaffarnagar districts.

Police listed at least nine cases of robbery and loot which the gang committed since October last year. Four cases, including a robbery at a jewellery store in Muzaffarnagar, took place in January. Police had been under pressure to solve the spate of robberies and loot for some time.

The gang was busted and stolen goods were recovered from it due to coordination among police in the two districts, said Prashant Kumar, additional director general (Meerut zone).

Police said Rs 20,000 in cash, gold jewellery worth Rs 4 lakh, 15 kg of silver ornaments, countrymade firearms, two motorcycles and a car were seized from the gang.

Title: Ganga rejuvenation in mind, govt to impart organic farming training to 1k farmers
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Bijnor: As part of Ganga rejuvenation measures, the agriculture department is planning to organise a training session on organic farming for at least 1,000 farmers of Ganga delta area at Chandrashekhar Azad University in Kanpur on Wednesday.

According to experts, the programme would not only promote organic farming but also help in the rejuvenation of Ganga, which is often polluted due to rampant use of pesticides. They said that pesticides from the fields are washed away into the river during the monsoon season thereby both polluting it and affecting the aquatic life detrimentally.

River Ganga passes through 26 districts of UP covering 21 civic bodies and 1,026 village panchayats. Farming activities are widespread along the banks of the river. As the river is home to 712 dolphins from Bijnor to Ballia, around 788 gharials, several otters and a variety of other marine species. Hence, the government aims to boost the ecosystem along the river by promoting green and sustainable ways of farming.

Deputy director of agriculture department JP Chaudhary said, “A one-day training programme for farmers will be held in Kanpur on Wednesday. During the session, experts will impart training on cow-based farming which is also known as zero budget farming. It is very beneficial for them as they have to spend money only on rearing cows. Also, the waste products can also be used to grow crops. Such traditional practices will boost the fertility of the soil too.”

“Farmers from 1,026 villages will participate in the training programme. Chief minister Yogi Adityanath will also be present. In the first phase, we have shortlisted one farmer each from the villages located on the banks of Ganga. They will pass over the techniques to their counterparts,” he added.

Agricultural Technology Management Agency (Atma) project director Yogendrapal Yogi said, “From Bijnor, 22 farmers have been shortlisted. All the preparations have been made for the programme.”

According to officials, Ganga is one of the ten most polluted rivers in the world. The primary sources polluting it are garbage, plastic, sewage water, human waste and industrial effluents. Pesticides used for farming along the river also add to the pollution.

Title: Gawali losing grip over dist politics?
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Yavatmal: Shiv Sena MP from Yavatmal-Washim, Bhavana Gawali , seems to have been totally sidelined from party programmes as a result of her differences with state forest minister and district guardian minister Sanjay Rathod .

Rathod is representing Digras assembly segment for the third time in a row while Gawali is a five-time MP. Last week, Gawali wasn’t among the party functionaries who accompanied Dushiyant Chaturvedi when he filed his nomination for the Yavatmal MLC bypoll. Even senior leaders and ministers of Congress and NCP were present.

Bhavana’s photos and her name have disappeared from party functions. Her supporters can now be found in the camp of Rathod.

The rift between them started over gaining supremacy in district politics. Gawali had in the past succeeded in stalling appointments of district chiefs for Yavatmal and Washim made by Rathod due to her proximity with Matoshree.

During the Lok Sabha election party chief and now chief minister Uddhav Thackeray had instructed Rathod to work for party candidate Gawali without any reservation. Still, Rathod kept a low profile during the poll while Gawali retained her seat by defeating Congress heavyweight Manikrao Thakre by a huge margin.

Later, Gawali remained absent from election campaign for Rathod and focused on her hometown Washim where she publicly declared support for Shiv Sena rebel. Gawali had then said she was even ready to face action from the party chief who had cautioned party workers against any rebellion.

When Sena formed the government with NCP and Congress in state, Gawali and her supporters rushed to Mumbai and registered their opposition to induction of Rathod as cabinet minister. She pleaded for giving cabinet berth to a neta from either Akola or Buldhana.

Gawali even objected to Rathod’s appointment as the guardian minister and instead lobbied for herself.

Title: After Centre’s accolade, Sindoda celebrates Swachhta ki Diwali
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Indore: Villagers of Sindoda gram panchayat on Monday celebrated ‘Swachhta Ki Diwali’ after Centre recognized it as state’s first single-use plastic free village.

All 475 households of the village by decorated their residences with lights, rangoli and diyas like Diwali celebration. District collector and zila panchayat CEO took part in the celebrations.

Children burst crackers and also danced to tunes of cleanliness like ‘Chauka Lagayenge’ to encourage others to maintain sanitation and say no to single-use plastic. Secretaries of 25 gram panchayats of Indore, which have been taken in next phase of declaring single-use plastic free participated in the event and learnt about Sindoda-model to implement it in their respective areas.

One of happiest villagers was Vikash Sharma, who is deaf and mute and was nominated as Sindoda cleanliness crusader. He recalled his contributions in helping the village achieving the feat as he roamed on a motorcycle playing tunes of cleanliness and encouraging participation of locals during the transformation period of around three months. The district administration has formed self-help groups (SHGs) of local women, bartaan bank and promoted use of cloth bags, paper-bags.

One of the major highlights was local families organizing five marriages in last three months by ensuring ban on single-use plastic. “Sindoda is perfect example of public-administration participation in getting rid of single-use plastic. We are encouraging other villages to follow the model,” zila panchayat CEO Neha Meena told TOI.

District collector Lokesh Kumar Jatav, who received a warm welcome by locals officially inaugurated a water ATM and chiller facility. “People in Indore celebrate cleanliness like Diwali festivities and this makes it number one in the country. Chief minister Kamal Nath is likely to felicitate the village in Republic Day event,” he said.

Title: CM Naveen Patnaik unveils new farm policy for better income
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

CM Naveen Patnaik

BHUBANESWAR: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik here on Monday launched a new agriculture policy for the state — Samruddhi— that will focus on enhancing farmers’ income, pushing crop diversification and ensuring increased use of technology in farming .

Addressing farmers during Krushi Odisha 2020 — the annual agriculture fair — at Janata Maidan here Naveen said, “I want farmers of the state should live with dignity. We are working towards development of farmers. Kalia scheme has enhanced the prestige of farmers. Several steps are being taken by the government to ensure farmers make extensive use of new technology and become face of development.” The five-day agri-fair will focus on enhancing farm income by exposing farmers to latest technological developments in agriculture, market linkage, value addition and sourcing of products from Odisha.

Agriculture minister Arun Sahoo said, “Income of farmers in Odisha has increased by 7 % compared to that during 2002-2003. The state government is now focussing more on cultivation of millets in 70 blocks of 14 districts and dedicated mandis for procurement of millets have been set up for the first time.”

He said, “Odisha is the third highest contributor to public distribution system in India and won Centre’s Krushi Karman award for six times in a row for highest foodgrain production.”

Title: ‘Spurned’ man, 55, held for setting house on fire, leaving 6 injured
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Meerut: Six days after the house of a woman, 40, was set on fire leaving her and five children injured-- two of them seriously-- police on Monday claimed to have cracked the case with the arrest of an elderly-looking man. Claiming that Farooq was 55-year-old, police said that he set the house on fire after being “spurned by one of the daughters” of the woman, Rahmeen. Farooq was financially supporting Rahmeen, who was ditched by her husband eight years ago, police said.

On January 13, the 40-year-old woman and her five children suffered burns when their house was set on fire. Two children were rushed to a Delhi hospital in serious condition and one of them is still critical. The incident took place at Zahidpur village in Kharkhoda region of Meerut.

Rahmeen works as a labourer to support her family. The accused, now identified as Farooq, was an acquaintance of the family and used to regularly visit them. According to sources in the police department, Farooq liked one of the daughters of Rahmeen, but she was “interested in another youth from the neighborhood”.

“This irked Farooq who began holding grudge against the family and decided to take the extreme step of eliminating them,” a police officer said.

“Farooq wanted to control the family, but was recently spurned. Due to that he took the extreme step,” said Avinash Pandey, superintendent of police (rural).

“Farooq was seen leaving the area in CCTV footages taken from the vicinity. He was later detained as a suspect in the case and was thoroughly interrogated where he confessed to the crime,” the SP said.

Title: 8 cities in Maharashtra among 100 in country to get new FM stations
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

AURANGABAD: The Centre has announced the setting up of FM stations at 100 cities across the country. In Maharashtra alone, eight cities have been chosen — Hingoli, Shirdi, Satana (Nashik district), Nandurbar, Achalapur (Amravati district), Chiplun (Ratnagiri district) and Sironcha and Aheri ( Gadchiroli district ).

Public broadcasting agency Prasar Bharati has asked the nearest All India Radio (AIR) authorities to undertake the necessary process for setting up the FM stations.

Hingoli MP Hemant Patil, who had raised the demand for setting up the FM station in his constituency with the Centre, said the proposed facility would be useful for education and entertainment purposes. “The Hingoli constituency is spread over 460 sqkm across 11 talukas. It has considerable rural and tribal population. The FM station will help in reaching out with educational, agricultural, environmental and health-related content among other topics,” he said. Patil added the radio station at Hingoli is expected to come up by October. “The government is expected to make a necessary budgetary allocation to set up 100 FM stations during the Budget for 2020-21. Each FM station will have 100W transmitter which can cover a substantial radius around it if erected at a proper height,” the MP said.

The demand for FM station for Hingoli was placed on behalf of the Krishi Vigyan Kendra (KVK) located at Tondapur in Kalamnuri taluka, which needs a community radio station to reach out to the masses.

Prasar Bharati has asked AIR authorities located nearest to the proposed FM stations to communicate the status of different pre-requisites — land required, conditions of rent agreement (if applicable), availability of power supply and approach roads etc. The public broadcasting agency has stated that the technical bids for procurement of 100W FM transmitters have been opened and are currently under technical evaluation. “After evaluation, the price bid would be opened. The procurement process of FM transmitters may take eight months,” Prasar Bharati has said.

The temple town of Shirdi witnesses a huge inflow of devotees every day and the proposed FM station can benefit them along with the residents. “The content to be disseminated by the FM station can be customised to suit the need of devotees. Information and updates related to the temple activities can be very useful,” said Sandeep Kokil , a private professional and Saibaba devotee.

Title: Mantri cleans dirty warehouse
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Pradhuman Singh Tomar took up a spade to clean up the warehouse

INDORE: The sight of a dirty warehouse campus was irritating enough for food and civil supplies minister Pradhuman Singh Tomar , who took up a spade and gave it a Swachh makeover on Monday.

Tomar, who visited the warehouse, was visibly irritated with dry waste spread in the open campus. He took a spade and cleaned the area to some extent before wanting to talk to IMC commissioner. “We all should maintain cleanliness as lack of sanitation leads to breeding of dengue and malaria mosquitos,” Tomar told reporters. Tomar in November had cleaned a stinking nullah and a toilet in Gwalior and Shivpuri respectively and videos of the same had gone viral on social media. Following the incident, IMC commissioner Asheesh Singh instructed local staff to clean the area. “The warehouse belongs to MP Warehousing and Logistics Corporation (MPWLC) and it’s their responsibility to keep the campus clean. If we find lack of cleanliness next time, we will take appropriate actions against it,” Singh said. MPWLC regional manager CM Mishra told TOI, “The warehouse is our property but there are some houses next to the campus boundary-wall, which is not tall enough to prevent people from throwing garbage there. We have however issued instructions to maintain cleanliness in the area.”

Earlier, Tomar raises questions on 200 quintals of grain kept in ‘suspicious’ condition in the warehouse. He asked officials to investigate the matter and submit report in 10 days. The minister also visited a fair price shop in Maharana Pratap Nagar and found irregularities in operations. He asked officials to investigate records and stock of shop . TNN

Title: Over 100 duped, raid on firm conmen
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representativ eimage

INDORE: A team of economic offences wing (EOW) on Monday raided several locations of fraudster Sanjay Dwivedi and his associates involved in duping over 100 people including farmers. Police recovered important documents related to the fraud.

According to police, Dwivedi along with his relatives and associates have registered 30 fake companies.

On promises of making people director in company and assuring them high returns on investment, he used property of over 100 people including farmers for taking loan from banks, said police.

Dwivedi transferred the money taken as loan for investment in the company into his account duping people on whose property loan was taken from banks, said police.

Dwivedi didn’t stop there. He had also formed a fake advisory company duping people promising high returns from share market. Dwivedi and his brother-in-law Piyush Sharma were involved in this company, police said.

A company representative used to called people and lured them into investing in share market promising huge returns. But, later they denied them any return claiming losses, police said.
