Title: Mangaluru airport on alert as IED found, defused
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

A CCTV grab of the suspect who is said to have planted the bomb.

MANGALURU: The international airport at Mangaluru was put on high alert on Monday after an “IED-like bomb” was found in the morning inside an unattended laptop bag at a ticket counter near one of the departure gates and an IndiGo flight call-back in the afternoon following a threat call. The bomb was defused in the evening in a controlled explosion.

CISF personnel had spotted the unclaimed bag around 8.45am. They immediately cordoned off the area and reported the incident to the police. The improvised explosive device (IED) was found packed in an iron box that contained a timer and wires, and it had about 1.5kg of silver powder used for making crackers.

CISF claimed that a tall lanky youth, wearing a baseball cap, seen in the airport CCTV footage was the suspect. The accused placed the bag near the ticket counter, took the escalator that leads to the parking area and exited the terminal and boarded an auto rickshaw, CISF authorities said.

Mangaluru police commissioner PS Harsha said three teams have been formed to trace the suspect.

After nearly nine hours of tense drama, the bomb disposal squad managed to put the device into a cooling pit and defuse it.

Though passenger services at Mangaluru International Airport remained unaffected after the IED scare, an IndiGo flight bound for Bengaluru was held back after the terminal manager received a call about a bomb placed onboard the aircraft. The authorities deplaned 126 passengers and subjected them to thorough checking. MIA director VV Rao said the flight, scheduled for 3pm departure, took off at 7.20pm after receiving an ‘all-clear’ from the authorities.

Karnataka home minister Basavaraj Bommai said police have gathered clues about the person suspected to have left the IED-laden backpack at the airport.

Title: KCR lost face togo to voters: Congress
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Telangana Congress treasurer Gudur Narayana Reddy on Monday said chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao did not campaign as he was not in a position to face people due to the long list of unfulfilled promises. “KCR did not skip the campaign by choice. He had to abstain to avoid facing people’s wrath for his failures,” Narayana said in a media statement here.

Narayana said the absence of KCR from the poll campaign was an indirect acknowledgement by him that his government has failed to deliver on promises. He reminded that KCR had announced in December 2014 that he would not seek votes if his government fails to provide drinking water to all households through taps. “Since the promise remained unfulfilled, KCR personally did not seek votes although he deputed his son and party leaders to beg for votes,” he pointed out.

Title: Academically weak students at govt schools to get ‘remedial classes’ soon
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Bareilly: Students at primary and upper primary schools in Bhadpura, Majhgavan and Meerganj blocks in Bareilly district, who performed poorly in the learning outcome exams conducted recently, will be provided with remedial classes to improve their learning level.

The education department is all set to hold a meeting this week, where primary and upper primary schools in the three blocks will be allotted academic resource persons (ARPs) for the supportive supervision of the students, who did not fare well in the exam.

The decision to provide ARPs was based on the results of the learning outcome exams declared last month. In Bhadpura block 64.7% of students scored less than 50% marks, followed by Meerganj (58.9%) and Majhgavan (57.8%). Of the 64.7% students in Bhadpura, 32.4% failed the test.

In Bareilly district, 92,116 students had appeared in the learning outcome exams in November. Of the total students, 44.49% got C, D and E grades (below 50% marks), said education department officials. Of the 44.49% of students who scored C, D and E grades mostly belonged to Bhadpura block.

However, the maximum number of students who secured A+ grade (80% to 100% marks) belonged to schools in Bithri Chainpur block with 34.1%, followed by Alampur Jafrabad block at 31.7%, said officials.

Basic shiksha adhikari Tanuja Tripathi said, “We have got school-wise and subject-wise data of students who did not perform well. They will very soon start getting remedial classes during school hours. The remedial classes, which will look into areas where the children are weak, will continue till February — when students will appear for the second learning level exams.”

District Institute of Educational and Training (DIET) conducted training of teachers for giving remedial classes, added Tripathi.

Anil Chaubey, a member of the state resource group, said, “We will organise a meeting this week, wherein we will allot ARPs to schools for supportive supervision. ARPs, along with headteachers, will draw a plan of action to improve the performance of students. Thereon, we will hold a meeting in the last week of every month to check the progress made by remedial classes.”

According to officials, the next learning level outcome test will be held on February 14. Last year, only students from Classes V to VIII wrote the test, but in February, nearly 2.25 lakh students from Classes III to VIII will take the test.

Title: Fire in E Delhi flat, woman rescued
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

New Delhi: A woman stuck in an apartment where a fire broke out on Tuesday afternoon was rescued after an hour-long operation in Mayur Vihar , Phase I .

Fire officials said that the blaze broke out on the fourth floor of the Glaxo apartment , after which eight fire tenders were pressed into service. The residents of the third and fifth floor had to be evacuated .

Delhi Fire Services chief Atul Garg said that they received a call at 3pm about the fire. As fire officials reached, residents informed about flames coming out of a flat on the fourth floor. Officials suspected that a room heater that was left switched on for a long time could have led to the blaze. A woman was stuck in one of the rooms and was calling for help.

A team from the Mayur Vihar police station and firemen used a fire extinguisher to break open the entrance door. The woman, who had almost collapsed due to the smoke, was rescued by them. Meanwhile, officials knocked on the doors of the adjacent flats to check whether anyone was stuck inside. The residents on the floors above and below were asked to leave their belongings and step out.

Officials said that the blaze was controlled in half an hour. Fire officials said that the residents were aware of the fire safety drills and helped in the evacuation.

Title: Delhi assembly polls: Shiromani Akali Dal-BJP talks collapse over symbol, CAA
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Manjinder Singh Sirsa

NEW DELHI/PATIALA: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) will not contest the Delhi assembly polls this time after its seat-sharing negotiations with Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) failed on Monday.

The seat-sharing talks between SAD and BJP started showing signs of collapsing on Monday evening, according to sources, after BJP insisted on Akali candidates contesting the poll on the ‘lotus’ symbol. It also wanted SAD to accommodate an Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) turncoat on one of the four seats that it wanted to contest.

Complete Coverage on Delhi Elections

Akali leaders Balwant Singh Bhunder (Rajya Sabha member) and Prem Singh Chandumajra (former MP) were negotiating with BJP’s Prakash Javadekar, Shyam Jaju and Tarun Chugh on seat-sharing for the past three days.

SAD leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa, however, claimed at a press conference that his party had decided not to contest the Delhi assembly polls on the issue of Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA). “SAD is of the firm stand that Muslims cannot be left out of CAA. We are also strongly against National Register of Citizens (NRC). SAD opposes NRC. We cannot accept that Indians will have to stand in queues to prove their identity. This country is for everyone,” said Sirsa.

Sources in BJP also said differences with Akalis over CAA have been a sore point.

Akalis supported CAA in Parliament and have justified its need, but want Muslims to be brought under its purview. BJP, however, has rejected the demand saying the bill was specifically aimed at fast-tracking citizenship for members of religious minorities from neighbouring countries of Bangladesh, Pakistan and Afghanistan, who fled to India before 2014 due to religious persecution.

Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari said every party has its own point of view and he respects the stand taken by the Sikh party. “But our alliance with SAD is still on. It has always supported us in Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha and they also have a minister in the Union cabinet,” Tiwari said.

Initially, there were strong indications that SAD would contest the Delhi assembly polls on its own. After it became clear that talks were not moving forward, Bhunder said BJP wanted SAD leaders to contest the election on BJP symbol and the idea did not go down well with the party leadership. He said the party had asked its candidates to file their papers and would contest polls on its own.

However, after BJP announced its alliance with JD-U (three seats) and LJP (one seat) while skipping SAD, Sirsa convened a press conference and announced that the party had decided not to contest at all. The SAD election committee, comprising Rajya Sabha MPs Naresh Gujral and Bhunder along with Chandumajra had finalised names of four Akali candidates for Rajouri Garden, Hari Nagar, Shahdara and Kalkaji seats — the same seats that Akalis had contested in the 2015 Delhi assembly elections . Other seats in Delhi that have a sizeable Sikh population are Tilak Nagar, Janakpuri, Adarsh Nagar, Krishna Nagar, Vishwas Nagar, Timarpur and Jangpura.

BJP sources, however, said SAD’s decision to not contest the election at all would not augur well for the saffron party. “The Sikhs in Delhi have always been pro-establishment. The presence of SAD used to divide their votes in other constituencies which have Sikh votes. We saw the Sikhs gravitating towards AAP in the last two elections. With SAD not in the contest now, the Sikh vote may totally go in AAP’s favour,” said a senior BJP leader.

Title: Delhi: Order saying in-laws can’t evict woman stayed by SC
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Supreme Court

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Monday stayed a Delhi high court ruling that parents-in-law could not evict an estranged daughter-in-law who was fighting a domestic violence case against them and their son from their house without providing an alternative accommodation.

The high court on December 18 last year had set aside six eviction decrees of trial courts against similarly placed women and said the women had a right to residence till their matrimonial ties subsisted.

Appearing for an elderly parent-in-law, affected by the December 18 order, advocate Prabhjit Jauhar told a bench of Justices Ashok Bhushan and M R Shah that the HC exceeded the jurisdiction under the DV Act, which provided that a complaint could be made only against the husband and not against the in-laws. “Can the liability for alternative accommodation for estranged daughter-in-law be fastened on the in-laws’ self-acquired property?” he asked.

The bench stayed the HC order and issued notice to the respondent daughter-in-law. Jauhar asked, “Can it be said that merely by residing for some period in the self-acquired and absolute property of the in-laws, the daughter-in-law acquires a statutory right to reside in the same and can the in-laws be fastened with a liability to provide alternative residence to the daughter-in-law?”

Title: Delhi: Cabs driven by women for women from IGI Airport Terminal-3
Content:
The cabs have only women drivers

NEW DELHI: With the launch of an all-woman cab service at Terminal-3, women passengers travelling alone now have a safer commuting option from Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA). The fleet of nearly 20 cabs is the outcome of a partnership between Sakha , a private company, and IGIA. Launched on January 10, the cabs have only women drivers , each of whom has been given self-defence training.The cabs, stationed outside pillar number 16 of the arrival forecourt of T3, can either be booked physically at the Sakha counter at T3 or pre-booked through its website, www.sakhaconsultingwings.com. The service is also available on IGIA’s website, www.newdelhiairport.in. The cabs can also be booked by calling 9999193004/9278708888.The fares are similar to other taxi services, which work on a distance-travelled model, along with a 25% additional charges for night hours (10pm to 5am). “This service not only provides employment opportunities for women but Sakha has also provided over a million safe rides to women and their families for over a decade now. The drivers adhere to the highest standards of reliability and integrity,” said an airport official.The cabs will be parked at the multilevel car parking area, with Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL) stating that more cabs will soon be introduced and the service will be expanded to other terminals too. The cabs can be used to travel across the national capital region, while two outstation locations — Agra and Jaipur — are also covered.“The cabs are well maintained and equipped with a panic button to ensure that, if required, the customer support team reaches the cab at the earliest to provide assistance. Some of these cars are equipped with wheelchairs and other facilities for physically challenged passengers,” said the official.“To ensure safety to women flyers, DIAL has initiated the women taxi service in association with Sakha Cabs, which provides safe transport solutions for women by women. It has already become quite popular among the women who feel vulnerable on city roads,” said a DIAL spokesperson.

Title: Three-member STF team to probe Budaun leopard killing
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

The leopard was beaten to death by a group of villagers soon after it attacked and injured a teenager and anot... Read More

BAREILLY: A three-member Special Task Force (STF) team has been constituted to probe the killing of an adult leopard in Budaun ’s Jarifpur Gadhiya village on January 12. It will be visiting the village soon. The STF is probing lapses by forest staff that led to villagers killing the big cat and how to handle such a situation in future.

The team has been asked to submit its report within one month.

The leopard was beaten to death by a group of villagers soon after it attacked and injured a teenager and another person in a span of two hours. After killing the leopard, one of the villagers cut off one paw of the big cat. Later, it was recovered by the forest department personnel.

The following day, an FIR was registered against eight named and 30-35 unidentified villagers under sections of the Wildlife Protection Act. The postmortem report of leopard is awaited.

Ramesh Pandey, one of the members of the STF and chief conservator of forests, told TOI, “STF will check if departmental action taken in the matter was appropriate. We are probing if there was laxity on the part of the staff. We will check the status of legal action taken in the matter and if it is moving in the right direction. Besides, we will suggest what action should be taken in such matters to prevent a repetition of such an incident in future.”

The other members of STF are forest conservator Javed Akhtar and veterinarian RK Singh of Kanpur zoo.

The killing of leopard in Budaun was the third incident to be reported in a week in west UP as one leopard each was killed in Bijnor on January 6 and Moradabad on January 8.

Lalit Verma, chief conservator of forests, Rohilkhand zone, said, “The measures suggested by STF in Budaun incident will be applicable elsewhere too, including Bijnor and Moradabad. Besides, we are in touch with senior police officers of Budaun and have identified locals who severed the leopard’s paw and were involved in its killing. The accused are absconding and efforts are on to nab them.”

Title: Vizagites pin development hopes on executive capital
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The state government on Monday introduced the Andhra Pradesh Decentralisation and Inclusive Development of All Regions Bill, 2020 in the Assembly to establish three capital cities for Andhra Pradesh. The Bill proposes to notify the area under Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority Area (VMRDA) as the executive capital, while the legislative capital will be located in Amaravati and judicial capital in Kurnool. The executive capital will house the secretariat, offices of the heads of departments and Raj Bhavan.

The government’s move to decentralise governance comes amidst dissatisfaction among certain sections of lack of development in north-coastal AP. Notifying Visakhapatnam as the executive capital is expected to propel growth in the region.

Senior bureaucrats from Amaravati, however, had made several visits to the Port City before the Bill was introduced in the Assembly, to enquire about vacant spaces. According to district officials, Millennium Towers and Startup Village in Rushikonda IT Hills are likely to house the chief minister’s office, the secretariat and other key offices.

Meanwhile, locals are hopeful that projects such as the proposed metro rail and the greenfield international airport at Bhogapuram will be speeded up once the executive capital shifts to the city. The legislation is also expected to attract investment to the region.

Welcoming the introduction of the Bill, VMRDA chairman Dronamraju Srinivasa Rao said the development authority will assume a crucial role in the growth of areas falling under its jurisdiction. “The VMRDA is currently preparing its master plan-2041 and perspective plan-2051. These plans will help identify major thrust areas, frame policy guidelines and vision for the growth and development of the region,” said Srinivasa Rao to TOI.

Ready infrastructure, provision of civic amenities and connectivity are expected to be major advantages in shifting the executive capital to the city. Further, once ongoing work on the six-way Anandapuram-Anakapalli highway is complete, National Highway (NH)-16 that passes through the city will be dedicated entirely to passenger traffic while heavy vehicles will be diverted.

Title: Police detain four suspects over solar panel theft in Moradabad
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Bareilly: Moradabad police have detained four suspects in the case of theft of solar panels worth around Rs 3 lakh, from fields in Mundha Pandey area in the outskirts of Moradabad. Police officials said the panels were jointly owned by the family of state Cabinet minister Chetan Chauhan, and the panels that were stolen being from the agricultural plot belonging to his elder brother Suresh Prakash.

Shakti Singh, the SHO of Mundha Pandey police station, told TOI, “Based on a complaint lodged by a family member, Aaryendra Kumar Gautam, on January 19, an FIR was lodged under IPC Section 379 (theft) against a farmer identified as Laxmi Narayan, who was looking after the farming on the plot. Four other suspects have also been detained and they are currently being interrogated. All those involved in the theft will be apprehended soon.”

On Saturday night, eight of the 16 solar panels installed in the field to power irrigation pumps were uprooted. The 30-bigha field is located on the city outskirts under Mundha Pandey police station limits of Moradabad, approximately 500m from the police station.

Title: Kolkata: Second organ donation in year’s first three weeks boosts 2020 drive
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: The family of a 20-year-old second-year college student, who met with a fatal accident on January 7, donated his organs on Monday, making it the second donation in the first month of the new year. The youth’s heart, lungs and two kidneys were transplanted to four patients.Sujoy Karmakar, the Kanchrapra College student was riding pillion on a friend’s motorcycle, headed for an examination centre in Haringhata, when the accident took place near Mohanpur. The rider, Papan Ghosh, died on the spot, while Karmakar suffered severe head injuries. He was first taken to JNM Hospital in Kalyani, from where he was shifted to SSKM Hospital’s trauma care centre (TCC) that was inaugurated last year. “Despite their efforts, doctors could not save Sujoy. The doctors told us Sujoy was brain death and counselled us to donate his organs,” said Sunjoy’s cousin, Dipannita Karmakar.Dipannita, who studied health sciences, was aware of organ donations but she was initially apprehensive whether Sujoy’s elder brother Sudeb and mother Maya Rani would consent to the donations or not. Sujoy’s father Sukar Rajan had passes away when the youth was a toddler. “But his brother and mother readily agreed that we should donate Sujoy’s organs to help others live. At this time of grief, it gives us solace that Sujoy will continue to live in others,” said Dipannita.The Kancharapara resident was declared brain dead at SSKM on Monday morning, once the family consented to the donation. ROTTO (Regional Organ and Tissue Transplant organisation) allocated the heart to Medical College and Hospital, the liver to Apollo Gleneagles Hospitals, while SSKM was allowed to retain the two kidneys.Last Monday, another road accident victim, Swapan Hazra, was declared brain dead and his heart, liver and kidneys were transplanted. The fact that this year’s first two donations have originated at SSKM Hospital, those involved in the movement hope to dispel the criticism that government hospitals recorded minimum brain-dead declarations.Like this year, even 2019 had started on a bright note with two donations in a gap of four days in January, but the year ended with 11 donations only. The figure fell short of four donations than that in 2018. “The SSKM’s trauma care centre could be a great source for organs as the centre deals with accident victims with head injuries. We hope the unit would help increase organ donations,” said a source in the hospital.

Title: Delhi assembly polls: Shiromani Akali Dal-BJP talks collapse over symbol, CAA
Content:
Manjinder Singh Sirsa

NEW DELHI/PATIALA: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) will not contest the Delhi assembly polls this time after its seat-sharing negotiations with Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) failed on Monday.The seat-sharing talks between SAD and BJP started showing signs of collapsing on Monday evening, according to sources, after BJP insisted on Akali candidates contesting the poll on the ‘lotus’ symbol. It also wanted SAD to accommodate an Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) turncoat on one of the four seats that it wanted to contest.Akali leaders Balwant Singh Bhunder (Rajya Sabha member) and Prem Singh Chandumajra (former MP) were negotiating with BJP’s Prakash Javadekar, Shyam Jaju and Tarun Chugh on seat-sharing for the past three days.SAD leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa, however, claimed at a press conference that his party had decided not to contest the Delhi assembly polls on the issue of Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA). “SAD is of the firm stand that Muslims cannot be left out of CAA. We are also strongly against National Register of Citizens (NRC). SAD opposes NRC. We cannot accept that Indians will have to stand in queues to prove their identity. This country is for everyone,” said Sirsa.Sources in BJP also said differences with Akalis over CAA have been a sore point.Akalis supported CAA in Parliament and have justified its need, but want Muslims to be brought under its purview. BJP, however, has rejected the demand saying the bill was specifically aimed at fast-tracking citizenship for members of religious minorities from neighbouring countries of Bangladesh, Pakistan and Afghanistan, who fled to India before 2014 due to religious persecution.Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari said every party has its own point of view and he respects the stand taken by the Sikh party. “But our alliance with SAD is still on. It has always supported us in Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha and they also have a minister in the Union cabinet,” Tiwari said.Initially, there were strong indications that SAD would contest the Delhi assembly polls on its own. After it became clear that talks were not moving forward, Bhunder said BJP wanted SAD leaders to contest the election on BJP symbol and the idea did not go down well with the party leadership. He said the party had asked its candidates to file their papers and would contest polls on its own.However, after BJP announced its alliance with JD-U (three seats) and LJP (one seat) while skipping SAD, Sirsa convened a press conference and announced that the party had decided not to contest at all. The SAD election committee, comprising Rajya Sabha MPs Naresh Gujral and Bhunder along with Chandumajra had finalised names of four Akali candidates for Rajouri Garden, Hari Nagar, Shahdara and Kalkaji seats — the same seats that Akalis had contested in the 2015 Delhi assembly elections . Other seats in Delhi that have a sizeable Sikh population are Tilak Nagar, Janakpuri, Adarsh Nagar, Krishna Nagar, Vishwas Nagar, Timarpur and Jangpura.BJP sources, however, said SAD’s decision to not contest the election at all would not augur well for the saffron party. “The Sikhs in Delhi have always been pro-establishment. The presence of SAD used to divide their votes in other constituencies which have Sikh votes. We saw the Sikhs gravitating towards AAP in the last two elections. With SAD not in the contest now, the Sikh vote may totally go in AAP’s favour,” said a senior BJP leader.

Title: Liquor shop manager robbed of Rs 2.5 L by two bike-borne men
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Bhopal: A 62-year-old liquor shop manager was allegedly looted of Rs 2.5 lakh, the store's daily collection, on Sunday night by two bike-borne men. The incident occurred near Banskheri Square in the posh Arera Colony of Habibganj, when Damodar Soni was returning home. According to Soni, the two accused hit his scooter from the rear. When Soni fell on the road and sustained injuries, the accused robbed his bag of cash and documents and fled the spot.

Habibganj police -- acting on the victim’s complaint -- registered a case of looting against the unidentified accused and started investigations.

SHO, Habibganj, SP Saxena, said that Soni, a resident of Indra Vihar Colony in Koh-e-Fiza, told police that he has been working at the liquor shop for the past 30-35 years. At present, he is the manager at a liquor shop at Manisha Market in Shahpura.

Soni told police that on Sunday night, the shop was closed at 11.30 pm. After counting the cash, he kept it in a bag and left for the company office, located at Bittan Market, on his scooter to deposit it. The bag was kept on the front platform of the scooter.

Soni further told police that around 11.45 pm, when he reached in front of SBI ATM in E5-Arera Colony near Banskheri Square, an unidentified vehicle hit his scooter from the back. The collision was so intense that Soni lost control and fell on the road with his vehicle. He sustained injuries in both his legs and shoulder. Before he could understand anything, an unidentified man allegedly picked up the bag carrying cash Rs 2.5 lakh, his bank passbook, ID documents and hearing aid. The accused ran towards the other lane of the road, where his accomplice was waiting for him on a bike. Both the accused then fled towards Manisha Market.

Soni said he raised an alarm, hearing which the security guard deployed at SBI ATM rushed out to help and informed the police.

However, police smell a rat in the loot story. CSP Bhupinder Singh said that usually cash from liquor shops is collected at night and is sent to the company office in a car. However, for the past three days, Soni was going alone to deposit the money. If cash is sent by a two-wheeler, it is ensured that two or three people escort the cash till the company office. These rules were not followed in Sunday's incident. Also, when a shop employee asked Soni to take him along, the senior citizen reportedly refused. Soni’s injuries were also superficial, which raises doubts, considering his age.

Singh said that police are investigating the case from all angles, including the involvement of insiders.

Later on Monday evening, police released CCTV grabs of two suspects, who were seen outside the liquor shop counter. DIG Irshad Wali announced a reward of Rs 20000 each on any information leading to the arrest of the accused.

BOX...BOX...

Bike looted at knifepoint in Khajuri

Three armed accused, including an autorickshaw driver, snatched away a 40-year-old man's bike at knifepoint at Sehore Bypass on Sunday afternoon. The victim, Shahid Khan, said he had sought help from the accused when he suddenly started feeling uneasy on the road.

A resident of Old Subhash Nagar, Khan works at a private company in Pithampur. On Sunday afternoon, he was returning home from Pithampur on his bike when he suddenly started feeling uneasy at Sehore Bypass in Khajuri area.

He stopped an auto-rickshaw coming towards Bhopal and sought help from three people, who were onboard, to help him reach till Halalpur bus stand. One of them got down and told him that he would drive the bike and asked him to ride pillion. When they reached Khajuri trisection, the accused, who was riding his bike stopped and waited for the auto. When the auto-rickshaw reached the spot, the accused discussed something with his two accomplices and moved the bike further.

Khajuri SHO, senior inspector LD Mishra, said that when they reached Bhouri Bypass, the accused, who was riding his bike, turned towards Bhouri. Despite Khan's objection, the accused took the bike under the Bhouri Bridge around 2.30 pm. The accused then pushed him, and when he fell from bike, he allegedly pointed a knife at him. The accused threatened to kill him and fled the spot. Khan sustained injuries to his limbs and waist. He somehow reached Khajuri police station and lodged a complaint.

Khajuri police have registered a case of looting against unidentified accused and started investigations. Sources said that the cops have detained the suspects in the case, and it will be solved soon.

Title: Bareilly: Lekhpal caught accepting bribe of Rs 4,000 in Nawabganj area
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: An anti-corruption bureau team caught a revenue department official red-handed while accepting a bribe of Rs 4,000 from a farmer in Nawabganj area of Bareilly district on Monday.

Inspector Surendra Singh, in charge of the anti-corruption team, Bareilly, said, “We caught lekhpal Ramchandra while accepting a bribe of Rs 4,000 from Rampal Singh, a farmer hailing from Nakatpur village under Nawabganj tehsil.”

“Rampal had lodged a complaint that the lekhpal was threatening him with preparing a wrong report of his farm to extort money from him. We detained the lekhpal and handed him over to local police after lodging an FIR against him. He will be sent to the district jail,” said the inspector.

In his complaint, Rampal had stated that after he lodged a case in the court of the sub-divisional magistrate, Nawabganj, stating that the land registered to his wife’s name was lesser than her actual possession, the SDM sought a report from the lekhpal. The lekhpal, however, demanded a bribe for measuring the farm and also threatened him to make a fake report of the farm if he failed to pay money, alleged Rampal.

The next date of hearing at the SDM court is February 5.

Title: Teach TRS a lesson in civic polls: N Uttam Kumar Reddy
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

N Uttam Kumar Reddy

HYDERABAD: State Congress chief N Uttam Kumar Reddy signed off the campaign with an emotional appeal to the voters to signal the beginning of an end to what he called an “aristocratic and arrogant” TRS government. Addressing roadshows in Neredcherla, Huzurnagar and Kodad municipalities on Monday, he said TRS was distributing liquor and cash to voters.

The TPCC President strongly condemned KCR for supporting the BJP Government at the Centre on the NRC and NPR issue by not speaking against them. Stating that not a single Muslim should vote for TRS in municipal elections, he said while Chief Ministers of many states have openly opposed CAA and announced that they would not implement NPR in their States, KCR has been maintaining silence on the issue. Despite repeated demands by the Congress for a special Assembly session to reject CAA, NRC and NPR, he said that the Chief Minister did not respond. He said the people of Telangana, especially Muslims could force KCR to pass a resolution against CAA in Telangana Assembly by not voting for TRS in municipal polls .

Title: Heritage activists rediscover remnants of old Fort Burj
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Heritage activists in Visakhapatnam recently took a walk up the old Black Hill to check out what remains of the Old Visakhapatnam Fort Burj (Fort Tower), which was once the northern frontier of the old fortified town.

According to the activists, much of the old Fort Burj, situated on the hillock, known as Black Hill was converted into a colony back in the 1930s and since then, much of the fort tower has vanished due to rapid urbanisation.

One of the activists, who took went up the hill in the old town, Edward Paul said, “That was once the highest point of the fort. The layout of the fort was very simple but strongly defensive. There were trenches, one towards the coast and the other towards, the marsh land.”

“The fort by itself was situated in a naturally defensive position, with the marsh lands towards the west, the sea towards the east and the Meghadrigedda Estuary towards the south (now the inner harbour),” Paul added.

He further said, “Even today the colony that is situated around the old Burj is known as Burjpeta, sadly with the exception of a few stone and brick-structures, there are very few remnants of the actual tower left.”

Paul added that most of the old European fortifications were built in places where the landscape offered natural protection and added that the Visakhapatnam Fort was no exception.

Heritage activists feel that Fort Burj could well serve as an anchor to re-discover the extent of the old fort and discover more about the old fortified city, because of which efforts must be made to preserve whatever is left of the old tower.

Title: Moradabad cops help families who made illicit liquor chance to get legit jobs
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

The response was overwhelming on Monday, with some 400 families turning up at the fair.

BAREILLY: Moradabad police have adopted a special strategy to wean people way from illegal activities by offering them an alternative employment. Police have organized a two-day employment fair for families involved in manufacturing illicit liquor in the city. The response was overwhelming on Monday, with some 400 families turning up at the fair.

Police managed to convince several NGOs, Vyapaar Mandal members and exporters among others to offer jobs to these families who have been struggling to make ends meet.

Last year, police shut down several illicit liquor manufacturing units operating in the residential areas of Civil Lines . As a result, several families were left with no alternative means of livelihood.

Appreciating the police’s efforts to give them an opportunity to work, Barkha, a job applicant at the fair, said, “We had lost all hope after the work (illicit liquor) was shut down. My husband and I are uneducated. My husband was forced to take up the liquor work as we had no other options. But we never wanted our children to lead a similar life. We wanted to send them to school and get an education but had no resources. Now, we will be able to fulfill our wish.”

Rekha, another applicant, said, “Who doesn’t want to work at a respectable place and do good work? We are very happy to be given a chance to be employed and associated with reputed organizations.”

Speaking with TOI, SSP Amit Pathak said, “The move aims at providing job opportunities to people and create employment for the affected families. Since most of them are poor and uneducated, they took up illegal work. But after the crackdown on liquor units, they faced more hardships.”

SSP added, “Providing them job opportunities will also curb chances of their getting involved in other criminal activities.”

Amit Anand, SP (city), said, “Around 400 families turned up in two days and applied for jobs. The applicants’ verification will be conducted and their criminal record will be checked. Thereafter, suitable jobs will be provided to them by the respective organizations. The jobs will be finalized probably by month-end.”

Title: Five killed in a road accident in Shahjahanpur
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

SHAHJAHANPUR: Five people died when their car fell into a pit after hitting a tree on Shahjahanpur-Pilibhit state highway near Nigohi town on Monday night. The victims were on way to Pilibhit when they met with an accident. The driver was speeding and lost control of the car.

Police had a tough time in pulling out the bodies from the mangled car. All the bodies had not been pulled out at the time of filing this report.

Dalveer Singh, SHO of Nigohi police station, told TOI, “All the five passengers were dead and the car was completely damaged after falling into a pit. It looks like the driver lost control while negotiating a sharp turn. We had to use a tractor to take out the mangled car from the pit. We are yet to identify the deceased.”

Title: Khelo India: Krishna wins 800m freestyle swimming silver medal
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

caption

Bhopal: Madhya Pradesh’s medal haul at the Khelo India Youth Games (KIYG) slowed down on Monday. The only player to add a medal to the state’s kitty was swimmer Krishna Ghadak who won the silver medal in 800 meters freestyle event of U-17.

Ghadak clocked 8.47: 23 to grab the second position. With this medal, MP has collected 40 medals in the Games so far including 12 gold medals and 12 silver medals.

In the semifinal matches of boxing and badminton, Madhya Pradesh players won their respective ties and made it to the finals.

In the semi-final match played in the under-17 boys category of boxing, Himanshu Srivas, boxer of Madhya Pradesh State Boxing Academy, performed in the 57 kg category and defeated the Haryana player 3-2 to make it to the finals. The final match will be played between Madhya Pradesh and Assam on Tuesday.

In the pre-quarter final of boxing played earlier, Himanshu Srivas defeated the Uttarakhand player 5–0 and the Uttar Pradesh player 4–1 in the quarter-finals. Similarly, Madhya Pradesh player Amit Rathore defeated Haryana player 21-11 21-23 21-16 in the semi-final match played under-21 in the badminton.

The state had won three medals including two medals in swimming on Sunday. In the girls’ under-21 wrestling, Nupur Prajapat gave Madhya Pradesh a bronze medal. She had won the medal in the 57 kg category. Indore’s swimmer Krishna Ghadak won bronze medal in the 400m freestyle of the under-17 category.

The Khelo India programme has been introduced to revive the sports culture in India at the grass-root level by building a strong framework for all sports played in our country and establish India as a great sporting nation. In 2019, MP was at the 13th place in the medal tally.

Title: AU distance edu school to hold spl exams
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The School of Distance Education, Andhra University (AU), will conduct supplementary and special drive examinations from February 19.

In a press release, director of the school, Prof P Hari Prakash said that these examinations will be conducted for the courses of MA in English, Telugu, Hindi, economics, history, political science, public administration, sociology, philosophy and psychology, MCom, MBA, LLM, MSc in mathematics, physics, chemistry, botany, zoology and organic chemistry, MEd and MCA.

The examination centres are the Government Degree College for Men, Srikakulam, Andhra University campus, Visakhapatnam, and AKNU MSN PG centre, Kakinada.

The examinations for MA psychology, LLM and MSc courses will be held at the School of Distance Education, AU campus, Visakhapatnam. The special drive examination is meant for students who took admission between 2006-07 and 2013-14 and wish to improve their marks or have to appear for an examination for a particular subject.

The last date for receipt of applications is January 31 and applications will be accepted till February 7 with a late fee.

Title: Lone JS MLA defies party line, votes for 3 capitals
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Vijayawada: In a major shock to Pawan Kalyan, Jana Sena ’s only legislator from Razole, Rapaka Varaprasad Rao, voted in favour of Andhra Pradesh Decentralisation & Inclusive Development of All Region Bill 2020 and Andhra Pradesh Capital Region Development Authority (APCRDA) Repeal Bill 2020, which were tabled in the assembly on Monday.

This comes in the wake of Kalyan writing an open letter to Varaprasad Rao on Monday morning requesting him to vote against the bills as per the stand of the party.

But Varaprasad Rao seemed to have decided to not toe the party line. Addressing the assembly, the Razole MLA said that Jana Sena supports the decentralisation of administration across the state and praised chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy for proposing to develop all 13 districts equally.

He went on to say, “Our party chief is really happy with the concept of three capitals. But he is opposing the move as he is in the opposition. I strongly support the bill on behalf of my party in the assembly.” He appealed to the opposition parties to appreciate the good decisions made by the state government. “I have seen many migrant labourers from Srikakulam district fight for their survival. The decision to establish the executive capital in Visakhapatnam will change the fate of these migrant workers from north coastal Andhra Pradesh,” Varaprasad Rao said.

This however is not the first time that Varaprasad Rao has shown his appreciation for the YSRC chief to his party’s chagrin. He had earlier made statements praising Jaganmohan Reddy’s administration fuelling nervousness among his colleagues.

Title: Keep eye on opposition: KT Rama Rao to partymen
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

KT Rama Rao

HYDERABAD: As campaigning for municipal polls ended on Monday, TRS working president KT Rama Rao asked party leaders to prepare polling agents and remain alert for the next 36 hours keeping an eye on any unlawful activities of other party candidates.

KTR, who is now in Davos to attend World Economic Forum meeting, spoke to party and coordination leaders on Monday morning. He said that while the opposition parties have resorted to mudslinging during the campaigning, TRS only took up development agenda and campaigned on the works done by its government.

He hoped people will choose TRS like in previous local body and assembly elections. “There is a chance of violence by the opposition parties in one or two divisions, which they try to secure.”

Title: UP: 22-year-old man suffocates to death while cleaning cane juice tank
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Image used for representational purpose only

BAREILLY: A 22-year-old man died and three fell unconscious while cleaning the cane juice tank at a sugar mill in Isanagar area of Lakhimpur Kheri district on Sunday evening.

The deceased was identified as Mohammed Fayyaz, 22, a resident of Budaun .

The mill authorities had finished crushing sugarcane and were planning to down the shutters after tank cleaning when the accident occurred. Sources said that four labourers — Fayyaz, Suhail, Farukh and Tafseel — went inside the tank to clean it but fell unconscious due to poisonous gases. They were rescued by the other labourers who rushed them to a nearby hospital where Fayyaz succumbed later. The autopsy report also stated that he died due to suffocation. Sources said that the labourers were not given any safety gear before entering the tank.

A preliminary inquiry by Dhaurahra sub-divisional magistrate Sunandu Sudhakaran found the mill management guilty of negligence. He then submitted his report to district magistrate Shailendra Singh. Sudhakaran said, “I have submitted my preliminary investigation report and there is clear negligence on the part of the mill administration. The labourer had died due to sulphur dioxide leakage. I have recommended an FIR against the mill administration but the family has not lodged any complaint so far.”

Meanwhile, mill manager Sanjay Singh said that the victim died after slipping into the tank accidentally and not due to gas leakage.

Title: Thieves buy tickets, steal from passengers
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Those travelling in trains need to now be aware of a new method being adopted by thieves who are making away with valuables from passengers in running trains. Interestingly, such thieves are procuring proper tickets from counters and then stealing from passengers.

TS Swamy, RPF (Railway Protection Force) circle inspector of Visakhapatnam station informed of this new method and said that the RPF is facing a challenge in resolving this problem.

Explaining the modus-operandi adopted by these thieves, the RPF circle inspector said that such thieves travel with valid tickets and take away valuables like jewellery and expensive smartphones after observing the passengers for a while. “We have received such complaints and are investigating them,” he added. An RPF official related a case where a man boarded a superfast train in Odisha having purchased a sleeper-class ticket.

He then lurked around the two-tier AC and the three-tier AC compartments. “As the train was gradually entering the Visakhapatnam station, the man made away with valuables from a passenger sitting in the third-AC coach,” the official added.

(Railway Protection Force circle inspector Swamy said that passengers need to beware of their co-passengers and should call 182 if they observe any suspicious activities in moving trains.

Passengers can take pictures of suspicious activities as well, Swamy said, while adding that passengers who make trips to the toilet to often draw the attention of such thieves.

Title: Finance minister accuses TDP of insider trading
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Vijayawada: Finance minister Buganna Rajendranath on Monday alleged that TDP leaders and their benamis purchased around 4,070 acres land in and around Amaravati before the official announcement of Amaravati as capital in December 2014.

“The erstwhile government and its ministers ignored the oath of secrecy. Heritage, owned by N Chandrababu Naidu’s family member purchased around 14.22 acres land at Kanteru village in July 2014. This is clear evidence of insider trading. The government later announced the outer ring road project connecting this land,” Rajendranath said.

The finance minister further alleged, “Former APNRT president Ravi Vemuri purchased around 62 acres land in Amaravati. Former minister Paritala Sunitamma purchased land in the name of PR Infra Avenues owned by her family members.”

Rajendranath also said that PAC chairman Payyavula Kesav had purchased land in Amaravati in the name of Payyavula Vikramasimha.

Kesav strongly countered the finance minister’s allegations and asked the state government to order a detailed probe on benami transactions as per the Act.

“The state cabinet announced Amaravati as the capital of Andhra Pradesh in October 2014. I purchased the land after that date. The government is making baseless allegations,” Kesav said.

Title: Kolkata: At 200, resting place for the dead to become a park for the living
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Charles Bruce, who set up Kolkata Scottish Heritage Trust in 2008 to salvage the cemetery

KOLKATA: A two-century-old place in the heart of the city for the dead that went to the seed decades ago has metamorphosed into a new space for the living .

The Scottish Cemetery , where 4,000 people had been laid to rest before being abandoned in the 1950s, has become a park in one of the most congested city neighbourhoods. Over 90% of those buried bear recognizably Scot names, such as Anderson, McGregor, Campbell and Ross, while the rest were Bengalis. “If you restore something that represents a large part of history, you have to make it relevant to people,” said Lord Charles Bruce , who has helped salvage the 6-acre cemetery that had turned into a rubbish dump and haven for anti-socials and drug-addicts.

Bruce, whose great-grandfather, Victor Bruce, 9th Earl of Elgin , and great-great-grand grandfather, James Bruce, 8th Earl of Elgin, served as Viceroys to India during the 19th Century, set up the Kolkata Scottish Heritage Trust in 2008 after reading an article by Mahatma Gandhi’s grandson Gopal Krishna Gandhi, then governor of Bengal. “He wrote that if sites, like the Scottish Cemetery, disappear, an important part of Kolkata’s heritage would be gone. It was a call to action and I responded,” said Bruce, who lives in Broomhall House, a 300-year-old mansion in Fife, Scotland.

None of his relatives though is among the 3,000-odd Scots, many of them from Dundee, buried there. The rest are Indians, who had embraced Christianity. James Bruce, after whom Elgin Road is named, is the only Viceroy to be buried in India, in Dharamshala. Three of James’s cousins, who had died in Kolkata before the Scottish Cemetery was built, are buried in South Park Cemetery. Initiating a worldwide connect with the cemetery, Bruce garnered funds from descendants of people who had served in India. “Kolkata had a very distinct Scottish commercial presence with firms, like Burn Standard, James Finley, Andrew Yule, Inchcape, Mackinnon Mackenzie & Co and Bird & Co. Scots also established schools and colleges, like Scottish Church College and Hindu College, which was later renamed Presidency College,” Bruce said.

Nearly 3,500 tonne of debris was painstakingly excavated and removed by hand. Then began the restoration of tombs. Restoration architect Neeta Das, who is spearheading the work, said, “Unlike the restoration of a building, which can then be used or maintained by the owner, maintaining an abandoned cemetery after it has been restored is a challenge. An urban conservation project like this requires involvement of local community. In a neighbourhood such as this, open space is clearly a premium and the cemetery had a great opportunity to offer that to residents,” she said.

The trust now employs 20 people and spends around £25,000-£30,000 a year on the project. Locals have been trained as gardeners and stonemasons. Horticulturist Biswajit Ghosh has planted hundreds of trees and shrubs to turn the cemetery into a garden. “We now have 10 varieties of palms, eight varieties of fruit-bearing trees, 10 varieties of flowering trees and nearly 25 varieties of shrubs. In a corner, we have also set up a garden for vegetables and medicinal plants,” Ghosh said.

Social projects have been set up to bring the surrounding community into the cemetery. Of the 270 families around the edge of the cemetery, around 115 are participating in the project. Around 70 children study in the Santiniketan-style open-air Saturday school at the cemetery, where classes on drawing, dance, literacy, maths and personal development are offered.

“The outreach programmes have won over the illegal, displaced inhabitants. A necropolis has been converted into a space for the living where the past is also remembered,” said architect Mukul Agarwal, who along with other members of Calcutta Heritage Collective, spent an evening with Bruce to figure out how to raise funds and take up similar urban regeneration projects.

Title: Minister Tulsi Silawat slams Niti Aayog's proposal to hand over district hospitals to private players
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

BHOPAL: The Madhya Pradesh government is opposed to Niti Aayog's proposal for handover of district hospitals on public-private partnership (PPP) model, said MP health minister, Tulsi Silawat, here on Monday. In the midst of opposition to the proposal, Niti Ayog has cancelled its consultation meet in New Delhi that was scheduled for Tuesday, said sources.

“Public healthcare system is aimed at improving medical treatment for the poor. The aim of having government-run hospitals is to provide free and affordable medical care to all. If district hospitals are handed over on PPP-mode and run for profit, where will the poor go for medical treatment?" said Silawat.

Chhattisgarh health minister, TS Singh, has also tweeted against the Niti Aayog proposal. Chhattisgarh is also a Congress-ruled state and health is a state subject.

The setback to the Union government’s policy making body comes as the Congress-led MP government is preparing to introduce ‘right to health Act' in the state. The Act would guarantee healthcare and also include penalty provisions for failure to deliver guaranteed services. Niti Aayog's proposal is called Public Private Partnership in medical education.

As per the proposal, a 60-year lease of district hospitals will be given to private operators. The scheme plans to link new and/or existing private medical colleges with ‘functional’ district hospitals through PPP. The need for such a move, Niti Aayog cites is based on dire shortage of qualified doctors and government's ‘limited resources and finances’. Stakeholders were requested to provide their written comments by February 25.

The PPP-mode operation of district hospitals has been a failure in Madhya Pradesh, said Amulya Nidhi of NGO, Jan Swasthya Abhiyan. “In 2015, the state government proposed handover of 27 district hospitals. Handover of Alirajpur district hospital has been a failure. In fact, Niti Aayog report has skipped mentioning it as a success story," said Nidhi. He termed the Niti Aayog proposal as ‘selling’ of public healthcare to private players.

Title: Assembly area turns into battlefield
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Vijayawada: The capital region witnessed violent protests on Monday when the special assembly session was held to give legislative nod for the trifurcation of the capital. The capital farmers and Amaravati Parirakshana Joint Action Committee (JAC) who gave a call for laying siege to the assembly defied police restrictions and stormed the assembly building through vacant area from all corners. Police lathicharged the protesters and detained them.

Many protesters were injured during the lathicharge and stampede that took place in the altercation with the police. As the protesters pelted stones, some of the police personnel were injured. Though the police held representatives of all opposition parties under house arrest, Guntur MP Galla Jayadev managed to come near the assembly along with farmers.

Tension prevailed as the cops took Jayadev into custody. While Jayadev’s supporters pelted stones at the police, cops lathicharged them and shifted them into vehicles. The police shifted Jayadev first to Narasaraopet police station before taking him to Rompicherla and Thullur police stations. Jayadev has been booked under sections 143, 332, 188, 353, 323, 324, R/149 of IPC.

Tension prevailed at Jana Sena office after the police did not allow Pawan Kalyan to come out of the office. After the political affairs committee meeting Kalyan was going to meet the injured protesters at Yerrabalem village. The police did not allow the party workers to come out of the office premises on Monday night.

There was huge police presence in all villages in the capital city region in view the protest call given by the farmers and the JAC. In Mandadam and Velagapudi villages, cops were deployed outside every house. The police removed the tents at Mandadam where farmers had been protesting for the last 33 days.

The police detained the farmers who tried to hit the roads in protest at many places across the capital region. More than 5,000 personnel were deployed in the capital region for bandobust duties.

The police also imposed traffic restrictions and allowed only employees with valid identity cards towards the assembly and the secretariat. Prakasam barrage was closed for general public.

In Vijayawada, former minister Devineni Umamaheswara Rao and 12 others were arrested. They were charged with indulging in acts of violence causing breach of public tranquility and peace. They were produced before the chief metropolitan magistrate court which granted them bail on the condition of furnishing two bonds of Rs 10,000 each.

Elsewhere, many key functionaries of the TDP were placed under house arrest in various places across the Rayalaseema districts of Chittoor, Kadapa, Kurnool and Anantapur on Sunday night itself. Former MLAs M Suguna, BV Jaya Nageswara Reddy and TDP’s Chittoor district president Pulivarthi Nani were among several leaders who were placed under house arrest. Police also stepped up vigil along all national and state highways to prevent the movement of TDP functionaries to Amaravati.

Title: Telangana: Bodies of three missing boys from Nizamabad found in trench
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Three minor boys, who went missing on Sunday from Neela village in Nizamabad district , were found drowned in a trench in the village. The bodies of the three boys — Siddharth, Deepak and Mukheed —were fished out on Monday after they were spotted in a trench.

Police said the three boys, all aged between 7 and 8 years, left their house on Sunday to play with motorcycle tyres.

While they were playing with tyres, they accidentally fell into a trench. Though police were not sure how the three fell into the trench, they suspect that the boys might have fallen at once into the trench, which was very deep.

The bodies were recovered by district authorities after swimmers were pressed into action. The bodies of the boys were sent to the area hospital for post-mortem examination.

Title: 4.500 cops for polls in Cyberabad
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: On Monday, Cyberabad police said that they would deploy 4,500 policemen to maintain law and order during the polls on Wednesday. Police said that there were 726 polling stations and 197 polling locations in Cyberabad limits. “Of the 726 polling stations, 129 were declared critical,” police said in a press note. “Check-posts have been established to prevent illegal transportation of liquor, money, arms and ammunition, explosives and objectionable materials,” said the police.

All wine shops and bars in areas such as Narsingi, Gachibowli, Raiduram, Ramchandrapuram, Bachupally , Medchal, Petbasheerabad, Dundigal, Shamirpet , RGIA, Shamshabad, Shadnagar, Amangal, Shankarpally, Rajendranagar were shut from 5pm on Monday and will remain closed till 5pm on Wednesday.

Title: New number, timings for AP Express
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The train number and timings of AP express , which runs daily between Visakhapatnam and New Delhi, will be revised with effect from January 23, according to a railways release on Monday. As per the revised timings, the up train (No 20805) will leave Visakhapatnam at 22 hours and reach New Delhi at 6.35 hours on the third day of its journey.

In the return direction, the train (20806) will leave New Delhi at 20.15 hours with effect from January 25 and reach Visakhapatnam on the third day at 5.05 hours. The train will stop at several stations including Duvvada, Eluru, Nagpur and Agra Cantt. tnn

Title: Maharashtra Metro tracks ready for inspections
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Installation of new track for Metro at Pimpri on Monday

PUNE: The Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited has approached the Railway Board, commissioner of Metro railway safety, and Research Designs and Standards Organization for essential clearances before rolling out the mass transport service in the city.

The Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited ( MahaMetro ) said it had provided the drawings and other technical details to these three establishments of the Union government and the railway ministry earlier. It has now sought time slots for ground inspection of the tracks and rakes, and review of other technical specifications.

Recently, the Metro rakes were placed on the viaduct and preliminary trial runs were conducted using electric traction.

The MahaMetro is keen to complete the safety inspections on the PCMC-Dapodi route (Sant Tukaramnagar to Phugewadi stations) in the next two months. Similar inspections would be initiated on the Vanaz to Garware College route at a later stage, after the MahaMetro completes the viaduct work and rakes are placed on the tracks.

A senior official from the MahaMetro said contact had been established with all the three organizations in the past few days to obtain no objection certificates (NOC). “We have provided them with technical specifications, designs, project profiles and basic plans. These establishments are studying the plans and they will come back with suggestions, if any, based on the observations.”

The official said the inspection of tracks was generally done in two parts — review of the project documents and physical inspection. The MahaMetro is ready for both after taking all necessary measures for the safety of commuters at the Metro stations and on the tracks, the official added.

The MahaMetro said a plan was being chalked out for physical inspection by the railway organizations. “We are still working on the visits of authorities from the three organizations. We are hopeful to carry out the inspection next month or even earlier,” the official said.

The MahaMetro would be able to announce the date of starting the Metro service in the city after the inspection.

Title: Lord Balaji made party in PIL on park encroachment
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Hyderabad: The Telangana high court on Monday made Lord Venkateswara a respondent in a public interest litigation (PIL) which questioned the construction of a temple in a park at Madhavapuri Hills in Ameenpur in Sangareddy district. It also warned the temple committee that if they fail to furnish necessary permissions “the temple is liable to be declared illegal” and may be demolished.

The committee will now appoint a lawyer for the deity during the next hearing on February 7. Stating that a temple is not above the law, the bench of Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice K Lakshman directed petitioner Thakur Rajkumar Singh of Human Rights and Consumer Protection Cell Trust to make the temple deity a party to the case.

The temple committee had been insisting that the deity is a juristic person, who could sue and be sued. The committee’s counsel said that as a legal entity the deity should be heard before passing any order involving his safety.

Petitioner’s counsel C Narender told the bench the committee had occupied nearly two acres of park land and was raising a temple there in collusion with panchayat officials. To a query, the Ameenpur panchayat secretary’s counsel said they had issued a notice to the Madhavapuri Hills Residents’ Welfare Society asking the temple committee to stop construction. “We have also made a representation to the station house officer requesting him to control the likely law and order situation that might arise when the construction is stopped,” he said.

However, he could not answer any further queries as to what happened after that. “What were you doing when the construction did not stop? Why was the SHO inactive? Did you make any complaint to the higher-ups in the police department?” the bench posed, but did not get a reply.

The bench made it clear to the counsel representing the temple committee that if they fail to furnish permission and sanctioned plan granted by municipal authorities, “the construction was liable to be declared as illegal and hence deserved to be demolished”.

The judges also brushed aside the contention of the counsel that the sarpanch wrote a letter to the endowments department seeking approval for the temple. “A sarpanch is not the competent authority in such cases,” the CJ said. “A temple is not above the law and the Constitution,” he added.

The committee’s counsel said that the temple and the deity were juristic persons and since they were treated as minors, their rights need to be defended and protected. The bench then asked the petitioner to bring the deity on record. In other words, Lord Venkateswara would be added as one of the respondents like the state’s panchayat raj secretary, commissioners of HMDA and GHMC and the temple committee.

Title: Passengers urged to reach Pune airport early in run up to Republic Day
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Pune airport

PUNE: Passengers boarding domestic flights from the city airport need to reach the facility at least three hours prior the departure time to ensure hassle-free security-checks and timely boarding because of enhanced security in the run-up to Republic Day .

“In view of the enhanced security measures, including additional checks enforced at the Pune airport, we request our passengers to report early (at least 2 hours in advance) and cooperate with the security agencies,” the Pune airport authorities posted on the Twitter handle on Monday afternoon.

The advisory coincided with the recovery of a bag with possible improvised explosive device components outside the terminal building of the Mangaluru airport.

Sources at the Pune airport said the flyers, to be on the safer side, should try and reach the facility much before the time mentioned in the advisory. “There will be the highest form of alert at the Pune airport in the run-up to Republic Day and because of what happened in Mangaluru. The entry of visitors into the terminal building has been stopped,” a source said.

“It will be safer for the flyers to reach the airport at least three hours before the departure time of their respective flights to avoid any hassles,” the source said.

The Pune airport has not used its Twitter handle or any other source to mention about enhanced security measures during events such as Republic Day or Independence Day in recent years. Pune airport authorities said they were coordinating with the airlines for the security arrangements.

An airport official said there might be long queues during the check-ins and security checks because of the enhanced arrangements. “Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel will randomly check passengers and their baggage at any given point in time. The body scanning machine will be used more frequently. The machine is currently being used at random and there been no complaints or objections from the passengers so far,” the official said.

“The area in front of the airport’s terminal building has been made free of any public transport movement. The CISF and the dog squad are ensuring a strict vigil. Airline representatives have been briefed to be on alert when it comes to baggage scanning,” the official said.

The airport witnesses a large number of arrivals and departures towards the evening till the early morning hours. The sources said the airport authorities were coordinating with the police to ensure random checking of the vehicles reaching the parking zone.

“There have not been any case of passengers missing their flights because of the enhanced security measures. But early arrival at the airport will mean hassle-free security check and check-ins,” the official said.

Title: Makhanlal university issued show-cause to 23 professors for not attending class on time
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative imafe

BHOPAL: Makhanlal Chaturvedi National University of Journalism and Communication has issued show cause notices to 23 of its professors for not attending classes on time.

There are around 32 professors in the university and 23 of them were allegedly not found in class on Monday, when vice chancellor Deepak Tiwari was on an inspection of the various departments of the university.

The professors have been asked to file their reply for their absence/delay at the earliest.

Sources said, the university management will take strict action if the professors do not respond timely of fail to provide satisfactory answers.

University registrar, Deependra Baghel confirmed to TOI that show cause notices have been served to the professors. “University time is 9.30 and during the inspection the professors concerned were not found in their class as well as departments,” said Baghel.

Incidentally, Makhanlal university has been struggling with the issue of student absences. A senior official of the university told TOI that action might be initiated against students also in the future if they do not attend classes properly.

Title: Maharashtra: 10 get double life term for killing sarpanch’s hubby
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

YAVATMAL: The additional district and sessions judge on Monday sentenced all 10 accused to undergo double life imprisonment for murdering Parva village sarpanch’s husband in 2018.

The accused had stabbed to death Mahesh Gawande on March 27, 2018.

The convicts are: Rajagopal Thakur (31), Gopal Thakur (30), Vinod Chapariya (38), Sunil Devtale (29), Hanumant Pendor (27), Shubham Tekkam (24), Sumit Meshram (22), Pravin Bhagat (44), Bhimrao Awathare (58) and Sunil Kumbhekar (21), all residents of Parva.

The victim’s wife Nilini (36), who was elected Parva sarpanch in 2016, had named the accused in a complaint to Awadhootwadi police.

On March 27, 2018, the accused had summoned Mahesh for a meeting in connection with money he had borrowed from them, the sarpanch had said, adding when her husband had gone there, the accused stabbed him to death.

The police had arrested the accused on March 28. The then SDPO of Yavatmal Piyush Jagtap had filed the charge sheet.

After hearing both sides, the judge A Mohinuddin MA found the accused guilty and awarded double life imprisonment under Section 302 and imposed fine under sections 143, 147, 148, 149, 120 (B) and 34 of IPC.

Title: School police clubs to check crimes against kids
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Trichy: To prevent adolescent children from falling victim to sexual harassments, police clubs will be formed in schools.

Police clubs were formed in colleges, which were effective in sensitizing teenage students to keep themselves safe in the virtual world. The need however is felt more in schools, said Trichy range deputy inspector general of police V Balakrishnan.

He said school students will be added as ambassadors to fight crimes against children. The primary objective was to sensitize these children on the protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act, 2012. Besides this, they will be elaborately explained about cybercrimes and how to prevent themselves from cybercrimes.

They will also be taught on some of the self-defence techniques to an extent that they may be able to protect themselves in case of any eventuality. The whole idea of introducing police club in schools was based on a study, which included interviews with victims of Pocso cases over the last one decade, said Balakrishnan. In most under-age marriages or elopement cases, the attraction seems to be coming as early as in the age of 13-14. We then decided that it would be appropriate to start this in colleges and schools, he said.

In the first stage, Trichy, Karur, Perambalur, Ariyalur and Pudukottai districts will have five schools selected each in the first stage. Each school will have a police club with 30 students each.

Title: Focus on entire Andhra Pradesh, not merely Amaravati, says Jaganmohan Reddy
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Jaganmohan Reddy

VIJAYAWADA: Replying to the debate on the bill to repeal the APCRDA Act in the assembly on Monday, chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy said that his government was committed to provide basic infrastructure to people, distribute development to every part of the 13 districts, instead of spending big on a dream city.

He said addressing people’s pressing issues are far more important to his government rather than spending Rs 1 lakh crore in the 8-km radius of Amaravati.

He cited the recommendations of Sri Krishna Committee, Sivaramakrishnan Committee besides the Sri Bagh Pact, where decentralization of administration and development were recommended in his address.

“People in Rayalaseema and Uttarandhra feel neglected. There is no drinking water. They need water for agriculture and we need irrigation projects. We have to be judicious in spending whatever money we have,” the CM said.

“We are a new state, started our journey with revenue deficit. Naidu planned a big city with empty coffers much against the advice of Sri Krishna Committee and Sivaramakrishnan committee,” the chief minister said.

He discounted the claims of former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu that Amaravati is a self-finance capital and wondered how would the government mobilise the money to fund the dream city. “As of now, we need Rs 1.09 lakh crore to provide infrastructure in Amaravati. Naidu had spent Rs 5,674 crore during his period and at that rate, the city would take at least 100 years to complete and the investment would run into several crores of rupees,” the CM said.

He emphasized the need for spending public money without putting burden on the people. He said the state’s development would be possible if infrastructure is provided in every part of the state rather than building a new city.

“The state would require Rs 45,000 crore to provide drinking water to people in the entire state. Shall we spend this money and give drinking water to the people or use it for infrastructure in Amaravati,” he asked.

Title: Maharashtra: Safety railings’ installation starts
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

The Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited ( MahaMetro ) has started installing 3ft-high safety railings on the viaduct between the Sant Tukaramnagar and Phugewadi Metro stretch.

MahaMetro has installed stainless steel railings on a 140m stretch on both sides of the viaduct. These railings will protect the workers while the work is in progress and then act as a safety barrier once operations begin, a MahaMetro official said. The 5km Sant Tukaramnagar-Phugewadi stretch, part of the PCMC-Dapodi section of Line 1, is expected to become operation in April. MahaMetro is installing overhead traction cables, carrying inspections and trials of the Metro rakes.

Title: Ahmedabad: Will Donald Trump open Motera stadium?
Content:
The new stadium, built at the cost of about Rs 800 crore, is almost complete

GANDHINAGAR: While Gujarat is abuzz with the possibility of US President Donald Trump visiting the state as part of his three-day tour of India, next month or in the first week of March, speculation is rife that Trump could inaugurate the new Motera stadium , the world's largest cricketing arena.According to key officials in the state government, PM Narendra Modi and President Trump are likely to inaugurate the world’s largest cricket stadium together during the US President’s coming visit to India. Trump may also visit the Statue of Unity during his India visit.This will be the first instance of a serving US President visiting Gujarat.Top ruling party sources said PM Modi and President Trump jointly inaugurating the Motera stadium would be a fitting reciprocation for the Indian PM’s ‘Howdy Modi’ event in the US last September.The new stadium, built at the cost of about Rs 800 crore, is almost complete.Speaking to TOI, top government sources said an informal communication was received from the government of India, asking the state government to make necessary arrangements for a possible visit by the US President along with PM Modi. “We have been told by Centre that both leaders will be in Ahmedabad for a day and will take part in the inauguration ceremony of the new Motera stadium. This could happen between February 15 and 22,” a top government source said.Significantly, PM Modi has confirmed his participation in the ‘13th Meeting of the Conference of the Parties (CMS COP13) to the Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species of Wild Animals (CMS)’, which will be held at Mahatma Mandir in Gandhinagar between February 15 and 22. The convention, administered by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) will be attended by delegates from more than 120 countries.Officials in the government are not ruling out the possibility of US President Trump kicking off his India tour by first visiting Gujarat. “Like the Chinese president, Japanese PM and other leaders, who began their India visits by first visiting Gujarat, the US president is also likely to first visit Gujarat before the bilateral talks are held in Delhi. The US president’s Gujarat visit will focus on cultural ties,” a top government official said.Sources said, “The BJP cadre has been asked to galvanise the NRI division and bodies like the Overseas Friends of the BJP in the US to ensure that a large number of Gujarati-origin US residents visit India during Trump’s visit. The BJP aims to have more than one lakh persons attend the stadium inauguration.Several top world leaders including Chinese President Xi Jinping, Japan PM Shinzo Abe, Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu, UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon, former US secretary of state John Kerry and other leaders have visited Gujarat after Modi took over as PM in 2014.

Title: Pune: Youth injured in leopard attack near Junnar
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020

Representative image

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD : A 28 year old youth was injured in a leopard attack at village Pimpalgaon Siddhnath, 3km ahead of Junnar, on Sunday morning, prompting the forest department to install a cage in the area.

Dashrath Bodke, a forest guard said, “Ganesh Khandagale had gone to water the crop in his field near Kukadi river in Vitthalwadi area when a leopard hiding on the higher ground pounced on him.”

Bodke said luckily the paw of the leopard got entangled in Ganesh’s jacket. “The leopard, however, dragged the youth for five feet, during which Ganesh hit the leopard with a bunch of keys. Resultantly, the leopard left him and ran away into the nearby fields,” he said.

He said Ganesh’s relatives rushed him to a private hospital in Junnar for treatment. “We suspect the animal to be a female leopard with her cubs nearby. She may have attacked the youth to protect the cubs,” Bodke added.

When contacted, Ganesh said after watering the crops, he was walking towards his two-wheeler when suddenly a leopard ran towards him from a distance of 100 feet. “Thankfully, I have suffered only some scratches on my stomach,” he said.

Title: Nath terms Nadda ‘son-in-law of MP’, hails his elevation
Content:
This story is from January 21, 2020
